yreaderx6/cdn83@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-56-29-575_9677f189641df618.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/daily-standup.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn67@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-56-37-628_305d9ddbfc0381fd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598306169561},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","title":"Marketing Leadership: 6 Rules For Leading Happy Teams","link":"https://coschedule.com/?p=84458","description":"<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85035 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/marketing-leadership-header.png\" alt=\"Marketing leadership rules to create a happy team header.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"581\" />\n\nIf you want to know how to lead a marketing team that does great work, you need a grasp on what makes them happy.\n\nIn a study on happiness and productivity among call center workers, published in <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2019/11/happy-employees-more-productive/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The World Economic Forum</a></span>, the authors found that happy employees achieved 13% higher sales than unhappy colleagues.\n\nDid they put in additional hours? Nope. They were simply happier. It appears that those happy employees simply used their time in more productive ways. Happiness seems to be responsible for at least some success in the workplace.\n\nThis matters to people who lead marketing teams — especially to the <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-statistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">97% who responded in a CoSchedule survey</a></span> saying they are not always successful in achieving their goals. How can you invest in your marketing team's happiness and produce better bottom-line results? Here are six rules to follow for happy marketing teams.\n\n[Tweet \"Marketing leadership: six rules for leading happy teams.\"]\n<h2>Lead and Manage Marketing Teams With This eBook and Template Kit</h2>\nStrong marketing leadership requires strong team and project management. Learn everything you need to know about managing marketing projects and teams with this downloadable ebook and template kit.\n\n[Cookie \"Get Your Marketing Project Management eBook Templates || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/blog-marketing-leadership-6-rules-for-leading-happy-teams-07.png || Download Now || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/Marketing-Project-Management-eBook-Templates-3.zip\"]\n<h3>1. Play to People’s Strengths</h3>\nSome work requires doing things that you don’t like, but you should always take the opportunity to give people tasks in which they will enjoy or excel.\n\nNot only will this keep people feeling positive, but it will create a better product.\n\nHere are some strengths to keep in mind:\n<ul>\n \t<li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Who likes learning new software and tech? </span>Ask your team what new tools they’ve tried lately and see who’s got a big list. Can they use this strength by making sure you’re using your tools most effectively?</li>\n \t<li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Who has outstanding social skills?</span> Look for the team member who always remembers birthdays, kids’ names, and weekend plans. Can they organize a team-building activity?</li>\n \t<li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Who is good at explaining processes? </span>Someone on your team is probably the one consistently writing numbered steps in the group chat or in emails. Can you pull them in front of your clients when onboarding, or can you have them assess some of your workflows?</li>\n \t<li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Who is a natural leader? </span>Is there someone who makes decisions and runs with them? Can you assign that person a team or small project to lead?</li>\n \t<li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Who loves playing with data? </span>This person might be the one who has their own ecosystem of spreadsheets which no one else can figure out. Can they use this data manipulation skill and interest to inform your <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">marketing strategy</a></span>?</li>\n</ul>\nA couple resources to identify strengths:\n<ul>\n \t<li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.gallup.com/cliftonstrengths/en/strengthsfinder.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">StrengthsFinder assessments</a></span> (now rebranded to CliftonStrengths) are an industry standard for assessing strengths and pointing out resources to help people grow.</li>\n \t<li>This <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://enneagramtest.net/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">free, fast Enneagram test</a></span> is fun, and it can help you identify aspects of your personality to understand how to work better with others and the your best environment.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>2. Provide Resources They Actually Want</h3>\nDon’t be fooled — not every “perk” is actually a perk. By and large, <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.frac.tl/employee-benefits-study/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">most employees value their health, flexibility, and vacation time</a></span>. Yes, even more than they value free snacks, free coffee, company-wide retreats, and employee outings.\n<div class=\"link-callout\"><strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-design-collaboration-templates/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Overcome Poor Marketing Design Collaboration in 10 Practical Ways With Three Templates</a></div>\nAs a leader, you need to ask yourself, <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">What does my marketing team need to succeed?</span> We know that autonomy, mastery and purpose help to motivate employees—and I’d wager that they help far more than enticing offers of free coffee.\n\nI suggest giving your team the flexibility and tools to work in the way that they feel is best.\n\n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85036 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/resource-questions.png\" alt=\"Questions to ask your marketing team to update your resources.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"872\" />\n\nThen, set them up with a selection of great <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/best-project-management-software/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">tools for managing their projects</a></span> (like <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-suite/work-organizer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule’s Work Organizer</a></span>), and encourage them to figure out how they can use them to their best advantage.\n\nLook for tools that:\n<ul>\n \t<li>Help them log time without hassle – a <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/time-tracking-software/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">time-tracking tool</a>,</span> like Toggl.</li>\n \t<li>Easily locate and share files – a <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://theecommmanager.com/content-marketing-platform/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">content collaboration tool</a>,</span> like <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-suite/asset-organizer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule</a></span>’s Asset Organizer.</li>\n \t<li>A calendar to help the team visualize their work – like <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-suite/marketing-calendar\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule’s Marketing Calendar</a>.</span></li>\n \t<li>Automate portions of their work – a <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/best-productivity-apps-tools/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">productivity tool</a>,</span> like IFTTT or Zapier (which integrates with CoSchedule).</li>\n \t<li>Manage recurring tasks – <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/task-management-software/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">task managers</a>,</span> like Trello or CoSchedule’s Task Templates.</li>\n \t<li>Understand on a qualitative level how they are performing – a <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://peoplemanagingpeople.com/tools/performance-management-tools/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">performance management tool</a>,</span> like Kissflow,People, Eloomi, or <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/team-performance-reports-demo/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule’s Team Performance Reports</a></span>.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>3. Make Space to Fail and Learn</h3>\nThose who fail together, trust each other. Those who fail, have the opportunity to learn and produce better work in the future.\n\nMake your workplace a sacred place where failing is acceptable — as long as something is learned from it.\n\n[Tweet \"Make your workplace a sacred place where failing is acceptable.\"]\n\n<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Example:</span> One thing we do at <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://blackandwhitezebra.com\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">our company</a></span> is the monthly Hack Day. We set aside all other work and “jam” on something together.\n\nOur Hack Days look like this:\n<ol>\n \t<li>We set a day in advance. We clear our schedules of normal tasks during that day. Sometimes client-facing colleagues will set an <strong>Out of Office</strong> automated reply, just in case.</li>\n \t<li>On the Hack Day, our team lead chooses a project to work on and presents the project to the group in the morning. We break down tasks, decide on responsibilities, and then break away to complete the work.</li>\n \t<li>We have a team lunch, and we have a more casual chat about what we’re working on and what we’re learning.</li>\n \t<li>In the later half of the day, we see the pieces coming together. At the end of the day, we sit back and take a look at what’s been done.</li>\n \t<li>Most of our projects are web-based and take a few weeks to come fully to fruition, so we usually review Hack Day projects on a monthly or quarterly basis, rather than doing a full review on the day we make it.</li>\n</ol>\nSometimes Hack Day tanks, but sometimes it’s the prototype for a brand new product.\n\nHere are other ways to make space to fail:\n<ul>\n \t<li>Ask your team members to include one thing that <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\">didn’t </span>work in your monthly review, and explain why it didn’t work.</li>\n \t<li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/agile-retrospective/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Hold retrospectives</a></span> where your team can talk openly about things that did and didn’t work in your projects.</li>\n \t<li>Model the behavior — show your team when something you tried didn’t work.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>4. Set Aside Time to Regularly Meet With the Team</h3>\nFar too many of us are overworked. <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://thedigitalprojectmanager.com/video-how-motivate-overworked-team/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Motivating an overworked team</a></span> is tough, especially when you feel like you don’t have the extra time for personal check-ins.\n\nThe occasional team lunch or one-on-one coffee might seem like an unnecessary expense, but it can do wonders for your marketing team’s happiness and morale. Your team will be happier if there is a sense of friendship and trust within the group.\n<div class=\"link-callout\"><strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/content-marketing-strategy-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Complete Start to Finish Content Marketing Strategy Guide (Template)</a></div>\nThis also means being quick to address conflict, so it doesn’t bring everyone down by proxy. Give your marketing team a chance to forge a strong relationship. People don’t like to feel like they are just another cog in the machine.\n\nTake the time to get to know your team.\n\nWhat are their hobbies? Do they have family in the area? What do they do on the weekend?\n\nMeet with your team members, one on one, and ask about:\n\n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85037 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/1-1-meetings.png\" alt=\"Questions to ask during 1-1 meetings.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"802\" />\n<h3>5. Stop Moving the Goal Posts</h3>\nOur digital world moves quickly, and many of us are guilty of moving goal posts as we get more data about how a particular campaign is going. It’s tempting to set a goal, reach a goal, and then say, “Okay, what’s the next goal?” Maybe the previous one was just too low of a guess.\n\nWhen you’re laying out your goals, take your time to <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-strategy/marketing-goals/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">set realistic, business-driven marketing goals</a></span> that will be a good cause for celebration when you achieve them.\n\nYou can use a sophisticated <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://peoplemanagingpeople.com/tools/okr-software/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">OKR software</a></span> that’s designed to help you do this, but even if you do, I caution you against setting too many metrics-based goals.\n\nWorking with too many KPIs or working with goal posts that shift place every time you near them is demotivating. What you need is a clear, concrete, and <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://venngage.com/blog/growth-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">OKR-driven growth strategy</a></span> that’s ambitious yet realistic.\n\n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85038 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/smart.png\" alt=\"What the S.M.A.R.T. acronym means.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"543\" />\n\nUse concrete, achievable goals, and use them sparingly.\n\nExamples of goals:\n<ul>\n \t<li>Increase conversion rate by 1% this month.</li>\n \t<li>Double the number of places we cross-sell our product this year.</li>\n \t<li>Maintain our client rating of 4.8 stars through the quarter.</li>\n</ul>\n<h3>6. Take Time to Understand Each Team Member's Long-term Goals and Help Them Get There</h3>\nThis goes hand-in-hand with getting to know your team as individuals and taking the time to understand what really motivates each of your team members.\n\nFew of us were born with the desire to run really effective instagram campaigns for a local restaurant chain. We all have real life goals that have far more sway over our day to day choices (e.g. starting a family, helping a parent, starting a business, being in a local play, getting in shape, finding a partner, etc.).\n\nDo you know what your marketing team envisions for themselves this year? In five years? Ten?\n\n[Tweet \"Do you know what your marketing team envisions for themselves? Ask them.\"]\n\nTake the time to ask.\n\nHere are some questions to get you started.\n\n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85039 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/professional-goals.png\" alt=\"Learning about your employee's professional goals.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"801\" />\n\nWhen the people on your marketing team feel valued on a personal level, this will invigorate a project and heighten your chances for success. That’s why it’s important to keep your marketing teams happy.\n<h2>Summary</h2>\nThere’s no golden set of rules for any team, but in our team, these are the things that work. Following these six rules helps us feel invigorated, motivated, and happy to be part of our team:\n<ol>\n \t<li>Play to people’s strengths.</li>\n \t<li>Provide resources they actually want.</li>\n \t<li>Make space to fail and learn.</li>\n \t<li>Set aside time to meet with the team regularly.</li>\n \t<li>Stop moving the goal posts.</li>\n \t<li>Take time to understand each team member's long-term goals, and help them get there.</li>\n</ol>\nWe know that <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"http://tintin.hec.ca/pages/decio.coviello/research_files/MoodCallCenter.pdf\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">people do their best work when they are in a good mood</a></span>, and as a marketing team leader, you can follow these guidelines in order to set the stage for happy colleagues who do their best work.\n<div class=\"link-callout\"><strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-project-management-skills/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">8 Marketing Project Management Skills You Need to Lead a Successful Team</a></div><p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-leadership/\">Marketing Leadership: 6 Rules For Leading Happy Teams</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://coschedule.com\">CoSchedule Blog</a>.</p>\n","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 10 Aug 2020 13:00:00 Tolle","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/marketing-leadership-header.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn76@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-56-11-031_a36fb4dd1a83ac0e.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/resource-questions.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-56-39-153_e39e3ae0cf32988f.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/1-1-meetings.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn12@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-40-204_59b7c07587649603.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/smart.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn67@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-27-164_4949e94139ea1bcb.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/professional-goals.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn83@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-56-36-226_1ae6752a5b281ff5.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598306169463},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","title":"52 Effective Social Media Post Ideas and Examples to Fill Your Calendar","link":"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297","description":"<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-83905 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/social-media-post-ideas-examples.png\" alt=\"Social media post ideas and examples header.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"580\" /> For a marketer, there's nothing worse than struggling with a creative block. When you're pressed to create on a deadline, but you just can't think of something original for a post or campaign, it's easy to fall into despair. In fact, that's probably why you're here. It's okay, though. We all need some inspiration now and then to help us shake off the rust and get back to creating awesome stuff. If that sounds like something you need, scope out this enormous list of social media post ideas. There's inspiration here to cover every social network, too. No matter where your audience is most active, you're sure to find something you haven't shown them before. [Tweet \"52 Effective Social Media Post Ideas and Examples to Fill Your Calendar via @CoSchedule\"] \n<h2>First, Here Are Some Super Useful Social Media Resources</h2> If you're going to succeed on social media, you need the right tools. These downloadable templates and resources will help you do something with the inspiration you'll get from this post. \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Social Media Calendar Template</strong>: Plan all your posts ahead of time.</li> \n <li><strong>How Often to Post On Social Media Infographic</strong>: Learn exactly how to map out your posting schedule.</li> \n <li><strong>Social Media Strategy Checklist</strong>: Build out a comprehensive strategy for your social media content.</li> \n</ul> [Cookie \"Get Your Free Social Media For Business Template Bundle! || http://coschedule.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-mockup.png || Download&nbsp;Now || http://coschedule.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Social-Media-For-Business-Templates.zip\"] \n<div class=\"link-callout\"> \n <a name=\"toc\"></a>\n <strong>Table of Contents</strong> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#choose\">Not Sure Which Social Media Network to Choose?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#practice\">How Do You Actually Put These Ideas Into Practice?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#ideas\">52 Content Ideas For Businesses to Post on Social Media</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#conclusion\">What Will You Post on Social Media?</a></li> \n </ul> &nbsp; \n</div> \n<a name=\"choose\"></a> \n<h2>Not Sure Which Social Media Network to Choose?</h2> Before posting to any social network, it's worth considering how each one is used. Here's a quick reference sheet: \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-83882 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/social-media-network.png\" alt=\"How to decide which social media network works best for you.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"3054\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"practice\"></a> \n<h2>How Do You Actually Put These Ideas Into Practice?</h2> If you're searching for social media ideas, you might be experiencing a few different problems: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Lack of creative inspiration</strong>. Sometimes, you just don't feel like you have anything kicking around in your head.</li> \n <li><strong>Constant fire drills to find content to share</strong>. You might also be scrambling day-to-day to find enough content to share.</li> \n <li><strong>Content that isn't getting results</strong>. In this case, it might be time to try something you haven't thought of before.</li> \n</ul> Sound relatable? Keep these solutions in mind: \n<h3>Plan Ahead With a Social Media Calendar</h3> The best way to keep social media posts organized is with a calendar. In fact, that's why we've included a free calendar template in this post. Here are some of the benefits of using a calendar: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>They give your team full visibility into your social media schedule</strong>.</li> \n <li><strong>They make it easier to plan posts ahead of time, </strong>and make sure you're posting at the best times.</li> \n <li><strong>They make it possible to plan content and social promotion in one place</strong>. No more switching between tabs and tools to map out your publishing schedule.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-editorial-calendar-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Effectively Organize Your Social Media Editorial Calendar (Free Template) </a>\n</div> \n<h3>Plan Cohesive Campaigns</h3> The best way to drive a message home is to build a complete campaign. Oftentimes, brands struggle to keep up with their social posting schedule because they're too reliant on one-off posts. This makes staying organized difficult. Plus, it's tough to always be writing posts on the fly without much thought ahead of time. Plan campaigns. These can be around: \n<ul> \n <li>Campaigns to promote events.</li> \n <li>A series of posts promoting a single piece of content.</li> \n <li>A string of branded posts carrying a consistent message or hashtag.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-campaign-examples/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">24 Creative Social Media Campaign Examples to Boost Your Inspiration</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Schedule Ad Hoc Posts</h3> In addition to your planned campaigns, mix in some ad hoc posts. These are spontaneous one-off posts that aren't necessarily connected to a broader campaign, but they still reinforce your overall brand message. This leaves some flexibility in your schedule — making it easier to react to trending topics and hashtags, which you can capitalize on for added brand exposure. With these three tips and all of the following ideas, you should have no trouble staying inspired and keeping your posting schedule full. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"ideas\"></a> \n<h2>52 Content Ideas For Businesses to Post on Social Media</h2> There's an endless possibility of content to share on social media, but these are the types of content your audience will appreciate. \n<h3>1. Your Company's Blog Posts</h3> Does your business have a blog? The best way to get your blog&nbsp;seen is to share it on your own social media platforms. You know it's relevant to your business because&nbsp;\n<em>it came from your business.&nbsp;</em> \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55795 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-2.png\" alt=\"Facebook post from CoSchedule.\" width=\"544\" height=\"606\" /> Be sure the content you're writing for your business blog is valuable and will connect with your audience. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/blog-writing-process/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Ultimate Blog Writing Process to Create Killer Posts</a>\n</div> \n<h3>2.&nbsp;Posts Showing Your Company's Culture</h3> What better way to showcase your business than by sharing a culture post? A culture post is an image or article that highlights what your business is all about. It could be a behind-the-scenes image of your employees doing something quirky, or an article about how your business does something a certain way. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-83469 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/culture-post-example.png\" alt=\"Culture post about CoSchedule on Instagram.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"874\" /> &nbsp; \n<h3>3. Industry News</h3> In raw numbers, news articles get more social shares than any other type of article. Most businesses that produce content are focusing on deep, \n<a href=\"http://neilpatel.com/2015/11/26/why-you-need-to-create-evergreen-long-form-content-and-how-to-produce-it/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">long-form content</a> rather than as-it-happens breaking news. Create a list of news sources in your industry. This could include trade publications or websites. Then, find those sources on Twitter and follow them. When they share something interesting, retweet it to your followers or share it on another social network, like Facebook or Google+. \n<h3>4. Curated Content</h3> Content curation is simply sharing the content of others in your niche. Sometimes, the things you want to share with your audience have already been written. Rather than spending the time crafting an in-depth post, you can quickly share one that's already been written (by giving them credit, of course). At CoSchedule, we use our handy-dandy \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-curation-tool-chrome-extension/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chrome Extension</a> tool to help with our content curation. Here's an example of a post we shared from Kissmetrics: \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55799 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-4.png\" alt=\"Shared post from Kissmetrics.\" width=\"613\" height=\"435\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-content-curation/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Schedule Your Social Media Content Curation For Massive Growth</a>\n</div> \n<h3>5. Question Posts</h3> Not everything you share on social media&nbsp;\n<em>has&nbsp;</em>to be a blog post or article. Get your audience talking and engaging with one another by asking a burning question. For example, you could ask, \"What sort of content should I blog about next?\" It's the best way to know what your audience \n<em>really&nbsp;</em>wants to read. Asking a fun question or creating a Twitter poll is a good way to get your audience's insights. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55800 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-6.png\" alt=\"Twitter poll about gifs.\" width=\"613\" height=\"347\" /> \n<h3>6. Product/Company Videos</h3> Visuals are eye-catching when your audience is&nbsp;scrolling through their news feed. It’s been proven time and time again that visuals help improve engagement, but what about videos? Research shows that videos have a \n<a href=\"http://wersm.com/5-stats-that-show-how-big-video-is-on-facebook/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">135% greater organic reach</a> compared to photos. That’s a crazy high number. Take advantage of this organic reach opportunity by sharing videos about your company or a new product you have. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55801 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-7.png\" alt=\"CoSchedule sharing a video about ReQueue.\" width=\"613\" height=\"525\" /> \n<h3>7. Customer Reviews and Testimonials</h3> Does your company have dedicated fans? Let their voices be heard and share their thoughts on your social media. You can do this by retweeting their kind words or creating a graphic with their testimonial directly on it. Don't forget to include their name/handle! \n<img class=\"drop-shadow wp-image-83883 size-full aligncenter\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/melissa-flicks.png\" alt=\"Customer testimonial post.\" width=\"770\" height=\"404\" /> \n<h3>8. Quick Tips and Advice</h3> Aside from sharing an entire \"How to\" post giving in-depth tips and advice, you can share a few tips that you think are the MOST important. Sharing a simple tidbit is an easy way to share valuable information with your audience. Here at CoSchedule, we call them \"Pro Tips\". \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55802 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-8.png\" alt=\"Pro Tip from CoSchedule.\" width=\"613\" height=\"163\" /> \n<h3>9. Memes or GIFs</h3> Aside from sharing images to your social media, you can use memes and GIFs when publishing your content. This adds a fun spin to your plain post and will be too irresistible for your audience to scroll past. \n<blockquote>\n GIFs are a great way to \n <a href=\"https://www.heyorca.com/blog/content-strategy/the-gift-of-gifs/\">showcase your brand’s personality</a>, stay trendy, and have fun. – HeyOrca\n</blockquote> Memes and GIFs are extremely \n<a href=\"http://www.convinceandconvert.com/social-media-case-studies/gifs-on-twitter/\">popular on social media, even among top companies.</a>&nbsp;At CoSchedule, we’ve recently started using memes and GIFs on Twitter and have found that they receive far more likes and retweets than regular images. \n<div class=\"SandboxRoot env-bp-350\" data-twitter-event-id=\"1\"> \n <div id=\"twitter-widget-1\" class=\"EmbeddedTweet EmbeddedTweet--mediaForward media-forward js-clickToOpenTarget js-tweetIdInfo\" lang=\"en\" data-click-to-open-target=\"https://twitter.com/CoSchedule/status/764174059831750656\" data-iframe-title=\"Twitter Tweet\" data-dt-full=\"%{hours12}:%{minutes} %{amPm} - %{day} %{month} %{year}\" data-dt-months=\"Jan|Feb|Mar|Apr|May|Jun|Jul|Aug|Sep|Oct|Nov|Dec\" data-dt-am=\"AM\" data-dt-pm=\"PM\" data-dt-now=\"now\" data-dt-s=\"s\" data-dt-m=\"m\" data-dt-h=\"h\" data-dt-second=\"second\" data-dt-seconds=\"seconds\" data-dt-minute=\"minute\" data-dt-minutes=\"minutes\" data-dt-hour=\"hour\" data-dt-hours=\"hours\" data-dt-abbr=\"%{number}%{symbol}\" data-dt-short=\"%{day} %{month}\" data-dt-long=\"%{day} %{month} %{year}\" data-scribe=\"page:tweet\" data-tweet-id=\"764174059831750656\" data-twitter-event-id=\"5\">\n  <article class=\"MediaCard MediaCard--mediaForward customisable-border\" dir=\"ltr\" data-scribe=\"component:card\"> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-media\">\n    <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55803 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-9.png\" alt=\"Meme on Twitter.\" width=\"760\" height=\"796\" />\n   </div> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-media\"></div> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-media\">\n    Just remember to keep the meme or GIF relevant to your company and audience!\n   </div> \n   <h3 class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\">10. Contest Posts</h3> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\">\n    Encouraging people to participate in a social media contest related to your brand will boost engagement with those who are already followers. They can help you increase subscribers by requiring those who don’t follow or like your page to do so in order to participate.\n   </div> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\"></div> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\">\n    Be clear about your objectives and exactly how you want your audience to participate for the best outcome. Define easy, simple rules before you launch your contest.\n   </div> \n   <div class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\"></div> \n  </article> \n  <div class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\">\n   <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55804 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-10.png\" alt=\"Pounds posting a contest.\" width=\"760\" height=\"338\" />\n  </div> \n  <h3 class=\"MediaCard-widthConstraint js-cspForcedStyle\" data-style=\"max-width: 1004px\">11. Holiday Posts</h3> No matter where you live, holidays are a big deal. Show your holiday spirit by sharing a holiday-related post on your business page. Whether it be an image, video, or article, your audience will appreciate that your business has real people that also get excited about holidays! Starbucks is known for getting exceptionally excited during Christmas season. \n  <img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-38486 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/starbucks-christmas-post.png\" alt=\"Starbucks Christmas post.\" width=\"770\" height=\"762\" /> \n  <h3>12. Photos From Company Events</h3> We discussed sharing culture posts that showcase your company's personality, but you can take that a step further by sharing photos from a company event. If your business hosts a charity event or fundraiser, a great way to spread awareness is by sharing it on social media. \n  <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55806 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-11.png\" alt=\"TBT post from Border States Electric.\" width=\"760\" height=\"798\" /> \n  <h3>13. Post an Answer to a Commonly Asked Question</h3> Are you receiving the same question over and over again from your audience? Instead of constantly responding to this question one by one, solve it once and for all by sharing a post with the answer. \n </div> \n</div> Make sure to \"pin\" the answer to the top of your social media page, so your audience can easily see it. Here's how to \n<a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/help/235598533193464\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">pin posts on Facebook</a> and \n<a href=\"https://socialmediaweek.org/blog/2015/02/60-second-tip-how-to-pin-a-tweet-2/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Twitter</a>. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55807 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-12.png\" alt=\"How to pin posts.\" width=\"760\" height=\"410\" /> \n<h3>14. Share Infographics</h3> Infographics are a fantastic way to show a step-by-step guide, especially on Pinterest (hello, DIY). Infographics allow you to share \n<em>a ton</em> of information with the use of visuals. They make boring statistics look appealing! Whether it be your own or a curated infographic, your audience will be drawn to the visual aspect and be sure to keep reading. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55810 size-full\" src=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-13.png\" alt=\"Pinterest post about social media stats.\" width=\"325\" height=\"597\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-images/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Make the Best Social Media Images the Easy Way (+84 Free Images)</a>\n</div> \n<h3>15. Start a Conversation With a Leader In Your Industry</h3> Cross-promote yourself by getting your name out there. The best way to do this is to start a conversation with somebody in your niche. Twitter is a great way to start up a conversation your audience will see. Find an industry leader's Twitter handle and make the first move! This presentation from Jay Baer explains the importance of connecting with influencers and how to find them. [slideshare id=37832657&amp;doc=8thingsonlineinfluencerscandoforyou-140809150058-phpapp01] \n<h3>16. Links to Free Resources</h3> Who doesn't love free stuff? Whether it be ebooks, white papers, or other downloadable content, your audience will appreciate the free resources. Put together a content bundle or a downloadable infographic, so your audience can use it for reference. You can get all of our bundles for FREE \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/resources\">here!</a> \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-55811 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-14.png\" alt=\"National Give Something Away Day.\" width=\"770\" height=\"397\" /> \n<h3>17.&nbsp;Podcast Episodes</h3> Sometimes reading content can be time-consuming, so give your audience's eyes a break and share a podcast episode. Even better; start your own! We recently started our \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/podcast\">own podcast</a>&nbsp;and have had great success with it! We cover topics and challenges our audience faces. If you decide to start your own podcast, check out \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-start-a-podcast/\">this post</a> to help get you started. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55813 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-15.png\" alt=\"Getting a podcast started.\" width=\"770\" height=\"604\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-start-a-podcast/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Start a Podcast (Authentic Advice from Someone Who's Done It)</a>\n</div> \n<h3>18. New Job Listings</h3> Is your team expanding? Let your audience know! Who better to work for your company than a dedicated fan who's watched your company grow? Maybe they have a friend who would be interested in working for you. Be sure to list what positions are open, like Built Visible does in this example: \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55895 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-25.png\" alt=\"Builtvisible posting about available positions.\" width=\"664\" height=\"675\" /> \n<h3>19. Hiring Announcements and New Team Members</h3> After posting your job listing, you're likely going to find the right candidate. Once you've found the right candidate(s), take it a step further and show them off to your audience. Let everyone know that you're excited to have them be part of your team. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55814 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-16.png\" alt=\"Introducing new members.\" width=\"770\" height=\"589\" /> \n<h3>20. \"On This Day In History\" Posts</h3> The Huffington Post shares \"\n<a href=\"http://www.huffingtonpost.com/news/this-day-in-history/\">on this day in history</a>\" articles every day. Take this approach and use it in your own social media strategy. Find something interesting that happened in your town or city, and let your audience know! You can also share \"National Day\" posts. Check out \n<a href=\"http://www.nationaldaycalendar.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">NationalCalendarDay.com</a> to find things like National Coffee Day — and tons of other days you probably never knew existed — and create some posts for ones relevant to that day. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55877 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-17.png\" alt=\"Sharing National Day posts.\" width=\"770\" height=\"808\" /> \n<h3>21. Event Promotion</h3> If an event happens and nobody hears about it, did it really happen? You can create an Event Page on Facebook to make your event feel more personable to your audience. Then \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/event-marketing-plan/\">promote the heck out of it</a> on your social media channels! \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55878 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-18.png\" alt=\"Creating events pages to help promotions.\" width=\"770\" height=\"559\" /> \n<h3>22. Live Videos</h3> Live videos have become huuuuge on social media recently. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, AND Snapchat have options for going live. Find the \n<a href=\"http://www.socialmediaexaminer.com/how-to-choose-best-live-video-platform/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">right platform</a> that works best for you and where you will get the most views from your audience. Try to make it a weekly video. For instance, \"Tip Tuesday\" or \"Fun Fact Friday\". This way your audience will be sure to tune in on those days. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55880 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-19.png\" alt=\"Weekly live videos.\" width=\"322\" height=\"559\" /> \n<h3>23. Promote Email Sign-Ups</h3> If you want your audience to attend a webinar or demo,&nbsp; you'll need to let them know by promoting the sign-up link on social media. Promote signup forms for webinars, demos, email newsletters, and so forth. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55881 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-20.png\" alt=\"Promoting live webinars.\" width=\"770\" height=\"606\" /> \n<h3>24. Image Scrambles</h3> You'll have your audience scratching their heads in no time when you post image scrambles. Image scrambles can be posts where an image is scrambled up or zoomed in, so your audience has to guess what it is. This is a great way to \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-engagement-tactics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">get engagement from your audience</a>. What is this a picture of? \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-38497 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/image-scramble-post-example.jpg\" alt=\"Example of an image scramble.\" width=\"640\" height=\"457\" /> Answer: It's an orange crayon! \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-content/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The 6 Types of Social Media Content That Will Give You the Greatest Value</a>\n</div> \n<h3>25. Inspirational Quotes</h3> Okay, I know. Inspirational quotes can be&nbsp;\n<em>cheesy, </em>but if done correctly, they can be effective. At CoSchedule, we use quotes from industry leaders that we know our audience will find relatable. Find quotes from leaders in your industry or testimonials from your audience&nbsp;that will resonate with your target audience. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-38498 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/inspirational-quotes.png\" alt=\"Inspirational quote post example from Ian Cleary.\" width=\"770\" height=\"403\" /> \n<h3>26. Company Accomplishments</h3> Believe it or not, your audience cares about you, and they want to see you succeed. Share your successes with them on social media and celebrate together! Whether it be awards you've won or reaching a certain number of customers, let your audience know! \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55882 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-21.png\" alt=\"Viber sharing their successes.\" width=\"770\" height=\"856\" /> \n<h3>27. Host a Twitter Chat</h3> What is a Twitter chat?&nbsp;It’s a conversation around one unique hashtag. This hashtag allows you to follow the discussion and participate in it. Twitter chats are usually recurring and on specific topics to regularly connect people with these interests. When \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/twitter-engagement-tactics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">hosting your own:</a> \n<ul> \n <li>Decide on a clear and brief hashtag that represents your brand.</li> \n <li>Choose a day and time that you can consistently hold Twitter chats.</li> \n <li>Come up with an appropriate topic and questions.</li> \n</ul> Plan and promote your chat via Twitter. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55883 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-22.png\" alt=\"Promoting chats via Twitter.\" width=\"770\" height=\"618\" /> \n<h3>28. Ask For Customer Feedback</h3> Not sure how your audience will respond to a new feature, event, or your next post? Find out how they will respond&nbsp;\n<em>before</em> it happens by getting customer feedback. \n<ul> \n <li>\"Would you be interested in a social media event?\"</li> \n <li>\"Would you like if we created a custom label feature?\"</li> \n <li>\"Would you like if we wrote a blog post about email marketing?\"</li> \n</ul> You can even do this \n<a href=\"https://support.twitter.com/articles/20174524\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">via Twitter poll</a> to get your answer. \n<h3>29. How-to Videos</h3> Aside from going live, you can create simple and short how-to videos explaining how a feature or tool works. These videos will give your audience an inside look, and make them more likely to try out your tool after seeing how it works. https://coschedule.wistia.com/medias/jflp6zjp18 \n<div class=\"link-callout\"> \n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/twitter-video-marketing/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Get Started With Twitter Video Marketing</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/facebook-video-marketing/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Do Facebook Video Marketing the Right Way</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/video-marketing-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Make a Video Content Marketing Strategy to Boost Your New Series</a></li> \n </ul> \n</div> \n<h3>30. Product Reviews</h3> User reviews are proven sales drivers, and something the majority of customers will want to see before deciding to make a purchase. Many people read online reviews before deciding to buy something. I'm guilty of this, too! This is a great tactic if you're working in e-commerce. Try sharing reviews of products you carry. You could also review a tool that your company uses or integrates with to help drive sales. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55885 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-23.png\" alt=\"Sharing reviews of company products.\" width=\"770\" height=\"709\" /> \n<h3>31. Images or Videos of Your Product</h3> The best way to show how something works is through visual representations. You would never buy a car without test-driving it first, just like you wouldn't buy an online tool or product without seeing how it works first. Give your audience a firsthand look at how your product works, and maybe even throw in a cool tip they might not know if they didn't see the image or video. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55801 size-full\" src=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-7.png\" alt=\"Short product demo for your audiences.\" width=\"613\" height=\"525\" /> \n<h3>32. Twitter Q&amp;A Sessions</h3> Sure, you could do a Twitter chat, but your topic has to be relevant, PLUS there's a great deal of planning involved. By simply hosting a Twitter Q&amp;A session, this allows your audience to ask a variety of questions. Your audience can finally get their burning questions answered, and you can interact with your audience in a new way. Check out \n<a href=\"https://passion.digital/blog/2013/12/10/how-to-run-a-successful-twitter-qa/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">this post</a>&nbsp;from Passion Digital on how to host a Q&amp;A session. \n<h3>33. Spotify Playlists</h3> If you want to share music or whole playlists with friends, \n<a href=\"https://support.spotify.com/us/using_spotify/playlists/save-your-music-with-playlists/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">posting a Spotify playlist</a> is the way to go.&nbsp;Sharing music with friends is a time-honored way to discover new bands, talk over your music tastes, and learn a bit more about the bands that you love. Spotify has fun and useful playlist sharing features. You or a friend can build a playlist packed with your own music or music you’ve discovered through Spotify’s massive music library, and you have the option of sharing that playlist directly with others by passing around the playlist URL or Spotify link. Let your audience know what you're listening to and get them inspired! \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55887 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-24.png\" alt=\"Sharing your playlists.\" width=\"770\" height=\"779\" /> [Tweet \"Get your audience pumped! Share a @Spotify playlist and let the world know what your office is jamming:\"] \n<h3>34. User-Generated Content</h3> We know you have super fans out there. Don't be afraid to show them off by posting fan-worthy content. Here at CoSchedule we send out 'swag' to those that grab our attention on social media or leave killer product reviews. Those people often share pictures of themselves decked out in our swag, and it's so awesome to see! https://twitter.com/AmandaHofland/status/785474494781546497 If a fan shares anything noteworthy about your company, give it a share! \n<h3>35. Posts Showing Off Your Company History</h3> Has your company been around longer than microwave popcorn? Then you have some history to share! It's always fun to see how far a business has come and where they started. Sharing a quick tidbit or piece of history is sure to intrigue your viewers. At CoSchedule, we are a start-up company, which means we're constantly changing, evolving, and even getting new space! https://twitter.com/ashtonhauff/status/845005165526749185 \n<h3>36. Company News Announcements</h3> Speaking of sharing your history and getting a new space, let your audience be in the loop. Getting a new space? Launching a new product? Just have big news in general? What better way to get the word out than by sharing the news with the people who care. Make it fun, and make it big. Get your audience as hyped about the news as you are. \n<h3>37. Create a Regular Series</h3> Here's a great way to use live video on social media: create a weekly series or show. There are a few ways you can do this. \n<ul> \n <li>Use a traditional talk show format.</li> \n <li>Have a guest each week.</li> \n</ul> Paste does this well, hosting musicians in their studio to perform on \n<div class=\"fb-video\" data-href=\"https://www.facebook.com/PasteMusicAndDaytrotter/videos/10156378216834529/\" data-width=\"770\" data-show-text=\"true\"> \n <blockquote class=\"fb-xfbml-parse-ignore\" cite=\"https://www.facebook.com/PasteMusicAndDaytrotter/videos/10156378216834529/\">\n  <a href=\"https://www.facebook.com/PasteMusicAndDaytrotter/videos/10156378216834529/\">Rainbow Kitten Surprise live at Paste Studio NYC</a>\n </blockquote> \n <h3>38. Repurpose Blog Graphics</h3> Creating new visual content for every social media post can be resource-intensive. Why not create blog graphics with social sharing in mind? To do this, create versions of your blog graphics correctly proportioned for your chosen social network: \n <img class=\"alignnone wp-image-83884 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/image-sizes.png\" alt=\"Guide to social media image sizing.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"8790\" /> Then, create social media posts or even entire campaigns around those posts, reusing their inline graphics. \n <h3>39. Share How-to Videos</h3> Social media is great for sharing quick videos showing people how to get something done. Here's a fun example from the DIY Network: \n <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55897 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-26.png\" alt=\"Sharing how-to videos.\" width=\"536\" height=\"767\" /> \n <h3>40. Share Your Company's Financial Earnings</h3> For large, publicly traded companies, your followers might be interested in knowing how you're performing financially. Consider creating an engaging GIF or video to accompany your earnings page on your website, or a blog post announcing your quarterly earnings. Here's an example from Home Depot: \n <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55899 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-27.png\" alt=\"Sharing company earnings.\" width=\"536\" height=\"385\" /> \n <h3>41. Share a Case Study On One of Your Customers</h3> Do you have a customer that you know has had success thanks to your company or product? Get them involved in a \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-write-a-case-study/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">case study</a>! Then, share it on social media: \n <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55900 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-28.png\" alt=\"Sharing customer case study.\" width=\"536\" height=\"403\" /> \n <h3>42. Share a Survey</h3> Check out this example from Case Study Buddy: \n <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55902 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-29.png\" alt=\"Prompt to take survey.\" width=\"536\" height=\"343\" /> \n <h3>43. Promote a New Product or Event</h3> Here's another example from Case Study Buddy: \n <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55905 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-30.png\" alt=\"Promoting new products or events.\" width=\"529\" height=\"698\" /> \n <h3>44. Share a Fill-in-the-Blank Post</h3> Asking your audience to finish a sentence can be fun, and it definitely encourages engagement. Think something like this: \n <blockquote>\n  \"What's your favorite ___________________?\" \"Fill in the blank: my favorite thing about [YOUR BRAND] is [ANSWER].\" \"When I need to [SOLVE PROBLEM], I use [PRODUCT/TACTIC].\"\n </blockquote> Get creative with it, and see what you can come up with. \n <h3>45. Share a Statistic</h3> This tweet from the CoSchedule Twitter accounts shares a snippet about Starbuck's marketing strategy that people might not have known: \n <img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-55906 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog-Halle-CreativeIdeas-New-31.png\" alt=\"CoSchedule sharing stats through Twitter.\" width=\"655\" height=\"581\" /> \n <h3>46. Reshare Your Top Performing Posts</h3> You don't always have to reinvent the wheel. If a post did well once, what's to say it won't do well again? In fact, \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/requeue-social-media-automation/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">according to research from CoSchedule</a>, there's data backing up the idea that it might even do better the second time around. \n <img class=\"drop-shadow wp-image-83885 size-full aligncenter\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/message-mileage.png\" alt=\"Get more mileage out of your messages.\" width=\"770\" height=\"493\" /> The easiest way to identify top performing posts and automatically reshare it is with CoSchedule. Use \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/analytics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">social analytics</a> to discover your best-performing posts. Then, use \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/requeue\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">ReQueue</a> to create an intelligent queue of social posts to reshare automatically. \n <h3>47. Promote Your Partners</h3> Add some positivity to your audience's feed and shout out a company you work with that's killing it out there. \n <blockquote> \n  <p dir=\"ltr\" lang=\"en\">Wow, what a lovely post to read. Thank you <a href=\"https://twitter.com/Sally_Newm?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@Sally_Newm</a> for nominating me and for everything you said. I honestly appreciate it so so much.</p> Thanks \n  <a href=\"https://twitter.com/rustybrick?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">@rustybrick</a> for pulling all these together, it is a lovely idea and really shows how much our industry value each other. \n  <a href=\"https://t.co/ir9nazs4kD\">https://t.co/ir9nazs4kD</a> –&nbsp;Samantha Noble (@SamJaneNoble) \n  <a href=\"https://twitter.com/SamJaneNoble/status/990935286363443200?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\">April 30, 2018</a>\n </blockquote> \n <blockquote class=\"fb-xfbml-parse-ignore\" cite=\"https://www.facebook.com/PasteMusicAndDaytrotter/videos/10156378216834529/\">\n  <script async=\"\" src=\"https://platform.twitter.com/widgets.js\" charset=\"utf-8\"></script>\n </blockquote> \n <h3>48. Share Some Interesting Industry Research</h3> In a lot of industries, having the latest knowledge and research is key to maintaining a competitive advantage. Tap into that by sharing stats and snippets of industry research reports, either ones you've created yourself or ones you've curated around the web. \n <h3>49. Use Paper.li to Share News Roundups</h3> Ever since Storify closed its doors, marketers have been searching for a replacement. \n <a href=\"https://paper.li/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Paper.li</a> is a great stand-in, making it possible to create custom social media-driven online newspapers. By creating an account, you can curate content from different social media networks and present it all in one place. Here's a look at how it works. \n <h3>50. Preview a New Product or Event</h3> Everyone loves being first to see new stuff. By consistently sharing previews of new products or features, your audience will know to go to your social channels to find your latest developments. This example from NAMM, a major musical instrument expo, uses a GIF to promote an exclusive events. \n <h3>51. Get Creative With Emojis</h3> Love them or hate them, emojis can add fun and flash to your social media posts. Make sure you're using them appropriately, and in conjunction with other guidelines, by following this infographic. \n <img class=\"alignnone wp-image-83886 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/06/how-to-write.png\" alt=\"How to write the best social media posts.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"7356\" /> \n <h3>52. Give Away Something Free</h3> Who doesn't like free stuff? By offering your audience an incentive to take action to get a freebie, you can drive some strong engagement and help promote your products. Here's an example from PlayStation. In exchange for pre-ordering a game, fans can get a free customized theme for their console, which the video demonstrates. \n <div class=\"link-callout\">\n  <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=55297#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n </div> \n <h2>What Will You Post on Social Media?</h2> Phew! That was quite the list we ran through. Hopefully, you can implement these tactics into your own social media strategy, but those aren't all the things you can share with your audience. Do you have something you like to share on social media? Let us know down in the comments!
