-32-434_f33de0826a5bdaf2.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/creative-brief-slide-deck-11.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn56@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-33-019_7c05413b9d7cf6bd.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/creative-brief-slide-deck-12.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn100@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-56-29-804_243f535886da994d.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/creative-brief-slide-deck-05-1.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn51@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-56-32-015_49247fe24f0199cc.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598306169490},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","title":"The 47 Best Resources to Train Your Marketing Team","link":"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304","description":"<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84971 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/marketing-training-header.png\" alt=\"47 of the best resources to train your marketing team header.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"585\" /> Marketing teams are constantly busy. There’s barely enough time to get on top of your \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-project-management/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">projects</a>, much less take a couple hours out of the day to do some marketing training. Here’s a thought: what if the training helped your team be more \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-operations-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">efficient</a> at their jobs, thus saving time in the long run? Not sure where to turn to find the right training opportunities for your marketing team? No stress. This post contains a comprehensive list of the best free and paid marketing courses to help your team hone their marketing skills. [Tweet \"Check out this awesome list of the best free and paid marketing training resources.\"] \n<h2>Help Your Team Develop Agile Marketing Skills</h2> Before we dive into all the marketing training opportunities, let’s talk about a much-needed marketing skill — project management. You know the feeling; the one where you’re drowning in work, chasing endless status updates, and barely keeping a handle on all the things your team is working on. We’ve all been there, but it doesn’t have to be this way. Check out how implementing an Agile approach to your marketing can change your life. [Cookie \"Get The Agile Marketing Guide || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Agile-Guide-MU-01.png || Download Guide || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/CoSchedule-Agile-Marketing-Guide.pdf\"] \n<h2>Table of Contents</h2> \n<ol> \n <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304#content-marketing\">Content Marketing</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304#seo\">SEO</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304#programming\">Programming</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304#analytics\">Analytics</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304#social-media\">Social Media</a></li> \n <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=67304#ppc\">PPC</a></li> \n</ol> \n<h2>Why Training is Important for Marketing Teams</h2> There is arguably no department at an organization that should prioritize training more than the marketing department. Hear me out on this one… Can you think of anything within an organization that moves faster than marketing? Marketers are beholden to changing social media rules, search engine algorithm updates, email privacy regulations… The list goes on. Marketers need consistent training to stay in-the-know. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84928 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/training-regularly.png\" alt=\"Reasons why marketers should attend training regularly.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"560\" /> Marketers are also often expected to wear multiple hats. How many times have you had to create a quick graphic for social media when you’re not even a graphic designer? \n<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">OR… </span> How many times have you had to jump into Google Analytics to check the health of your content marketing efforts, despite your limited analytics knowledge? Quite a few times, I bet. These are great examples of why marketers can, and should, take a course or two to brush up on skills outside of their expertise. \n<h2>Organizational Benefits of Training and Development</h2> Increasing employee motivation and decreasing turnover is something every company strives for. Turns out, a simple way to do this is to offer your employees a great training and development program. Here are all the statistics about the organizational benefits of training and development: \n<ul> \n <li>Companies have a&nbsp;<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"http://businesstrainingexperts.com/knowledge-center/training-roi/profiting-from-learning/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">218%</a></span>&nbsp;higher income per employee than those without formalized training.</li> \n <li>There’s a <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"http://businesstrainingexperts.com/knowledge-center/training-roi/profiting-from-learning/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">24%</a></span>&nbsp;higher profit margin for companies that prioritize training than those who don’t.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.shiftelearning.com/blog/statistics-value-of-employee-training-and-development\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">40%</a></span>&nbsp;of employees who don’t receive training will leave their positions within the first year.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.shiftelearning.com/blog/statistics-value-of-employee-training-and-development\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">87%</a></span>&nbsp;of Millennials say that professional development is significant to them.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.shiftelearning.com/blog/statistics-on-corporate-training-and-what-they-mean-for-your-companys-future\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">70%</a></span>&nbsp;of individuals say training and development opportunities influence their decision to stay at a company.</li> \n</ul> [Tweet \"87% of Millennials say professional development is a significant motivator at work.\"] \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84929 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/benefits-of-training.png\" alt=\"Organizational benefits of training and development stats.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"2641\" /> \n<h2>Training Opportunities for Your Marketing Team</h2> Here’s what we know… Providing staff training is important for both the profitability of the organization and employee happiness, but maybe you don’t know where to start. This post makes it easy; it breaks down all the best online training opportunities for your marketing staff. Let’s dig in. \n<a name=\"content-marketing\"></a> \n<h2>Content Marketing Training and Development</h2> Content marketing teams need to be both strategic and tactical. They need skills that encompass things like writing, research, creativity, and analytical thinking. Here’s a list of the best development opportunities for content marketers. \n<h3>CoSchedule Academy</h3> \n<script src=\"https://fast.wistia.com/embed/medias/4sg8wkthvo.jsonp\" async=\"\"></script>\n<script src=\"https://fast.wistia.com/assets/external/E-v1.js\" async=\"\"></script> \n<div class=\"wistia_responsive_padding\" style=\"padding: 56.25% 0 0 0; position: relative;\"> \n <div class=\"wistia_responsive_wrapper\" style=\"height: 100%; left: 0; position: absolute; top: 0; width: 100%;\"> \n  <div class=\"wistia_embed wistia_async_4sg8wkthvo seo=false videoFoam=true\" style=\"height: 100%; position: relative; width: 100%;\"> \n   <div class=\"wistia_swatch\" style=\"height: 100%; left: 0; opacity: 0; overflow: hidden; position: absolute; top: 0; transition: opacity 200ms; width: 100%;\">\n    <img style=\"filter: blur(5px); height: 100%; object-fit: contain; width: 100%;\" src=\"https://fast.wistia.com/embed/medias/4sg8wkthvo/swatch\" alt=\"\" />\n   </div> \n  </div> \n </div> \n</div> &nbsp; The \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://academy.coschedule.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule Academy</a></span> covers the IRL marketing frameworks that CoSchedule implemented to grow from zero email subscribers to nearly 850,000; from zero customers to 8,000 in only four years. Get access to courses about content marketing, plus SEO, project management, social media, marketing strategy, and more. \n<span style=\"font-weight: 400;\">The courses are taught by the CoSchedule experts behind our blog. Our instructors have tons of experience from building a million subscribers email list to averaging 700k+ monthly blog readers.</span> Over 30 million marketers trust CoSchedule for marketing education — start now and get the same, great benefits of the academy today. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span> Limited access – Free; Pro access – $250/year\n</div> \n<h3>American Marketing Association: Certification in Content Marketing</h3> This \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.ama.org/events-training/Certification/Pages/content-marketing-certification-skillsets.aspx\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">AMA approved</a></span>&nbsp;series of LinkedIn Learning courses covers relevant and in-demand skills needed by every content marketer, including strategy, planning, production, promotion, and measurement. Following participation in the course, individuals can take the AMA exam to become a Professional Certified Marketer in Content Marketing. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$29.99 USD/month via a membership to LinkedIn Learning \n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Certification cost:</span>&nbsp;$349.00 USD includes 3 attempts ($249 for AMA members)\n</div> \n<h3>UC Davis: Content Marketing Course</h3> UC Davis partnered with the awesome \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.copyblogger.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Copyblogger</a></span>&nbsp;to launch their \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.coursera.org/learn/content-marketing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">content marketing course</a></span>. Every content marketer needs to \n<span style=\"font-style: italic;\">write</span>, but they also need to know how to \n<span style=\"font-style: italic;\">sell</span>&nbsp;through their writing. This course also covers the analytics knowledge to know if your content marketing is adding business value. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;Free \n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Certification cost:</span>&nbsp;$49.00 USD\n</div> \n<h3>CMI University</h3> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BMnDK5PKk_Q Content marketing superstars, Robert Rose and Joe Pulizzi, take a deep dive into content marketing with their \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.contentmarketinguniversity.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">course</a></span>&nbsp;through the Content Marketing Institute. The course features industry leaders and content marketing practitioners, so you can learn for those who work with content marketing on a daily basis. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$995 USD/participant for first-time attendees.\n</div> \n<h3>Udemy: Create Content That Sells</h3> This Content Marketing Masterclass offers a complete guide to growing your business with the power of digital content. This course teaches you how to plan and execute a content marketing strategy that drives your business forward. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$199.99 USD (on sale for $9.99 at the time of publish)\n</div> \n<h3>Northwestern University: Content Strategy for Professionals</h3> Northwestern University brings us a \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.coursera.org/specializations/content-strategy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">content marketing specialization</a>,</span>&nbsp;which focuses on teaching you how to create content that adds real value to potential customers. You will learn tactics for using social media platforms to drive customer awareness of your brand and increase sales and how to implement a successful social media marketing strategy. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;Free\n</div> \n<a name=\"ppc\"></a> \n<h2>PPC Training and Development</h2> Search advertising is one of the best ways to ensure that potential customers are exposed to your product offers. It even has a better return on investment than most other forms of advertising. Why? Individuals have proven they’re already in need of your products by seeking them out on Google. Now, all you have to do is master your SEM strategy and get your brand in front of them. \n<h3>Udemy: Certificate in Search Engine Marketing</h3> The course aims to give learners an in-depth understanding of everything \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.udemy.com/certificate-in-seach-engine-marketing-basics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">PPC and SEM</a></span>. Learn how to optimize content, define KPIs, and set up high-performing paid search campaigns. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$74.99 USD (on sale for $11.99 at time of publish)\n</div> \n<h3>Lynda: Essential Adwords Training</h3> Learn the foundations of \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.lynda.com/Google-AdWords-tutorials/Google-AdWords-Essential-Training-2018/693109-2.html\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">PPC advertising</a></span>&nbsp;with the industry’s leading search platform, Google Adwords. This course explores how Google Adwords works, from setting up a new campaign, choosing keywords, and beyond. It’s a practical introduction to navigating the often complex environment of PPC optimization. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$29.99 USD/month\n</div> \n<h3>Google Academy for Ads</h3> If you’re looking to learn about \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://landing.google.com/academyforads\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Google Adwords</a></span>, who better to learn from than Google themselves? You can even become Google certified by taking an exam at the end of your learning path. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=87GrNuDl7W4#action=share \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <strong>Course cost:</strong> Free\n</div> \n<div></div> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Recommended Listening</span> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-strategically-manage-your-ppc-campaigns-in-adwords-with-rachel-wiinanen-from-coschedule-amp-046/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How To Strategically Manage Your PPC Campaigns In Adwords With Rachel Wiinanen From CoSchedule</a></span>\n</div> \n<h2>Graphic Design Training and Development</h2> Scrappy marketing teams often have to dabble in things outside of what they learned in business school; graphic design is one of them. With an all-hands-on-deck mentality, marketers often have to whip up a quick social graphic, flyer, or ppt at the drop of a hat. That said, a little graphic design training can go a long way. \n<h3>Udemy: Learn Photoshop from Scratch</h3> This\n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.udemy.com/learn-adobe-photoshop-from-scratch/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;course</a>&nbsp;</span>gives individuals a basic design introduction in Photoshop using items like selection tools, manipulation tools, and creation tools. It’s a practical course focusing on the most important techniques, which is great for beginners and intermediate learners alike. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost: </span>$19.99 USD&nbsp;(On sale for $14.99 at time of publish)\n</div> \n<h3>PluralSight: Illustrator CC</h3> Looking to master \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.pluralsight.com/courses/illustrator-cc-fundamentals\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Illustrator</a></span>&nbsp;and build practical examples? This course aims to give learners working knowledge to be a confident Illustrator practitioner. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$35 USD/month\n</div> \n<h3>Creative Live: Building Infographics in Illustrator</h3> Infographics are some of the best performing pieces of marketing content. The \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.creativelive.com/class/building-infographics-illustrator-jason-hoppe\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">course</a></span> teaches individuals how to create various types of charts and visual elements using Illustrator, in order to compile successful infographics. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;$49 USD\n</div> \n<h3>Canva Design School: Intro to Graphic Design</h3> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3FZGN7BCs6k \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.openlearning.com/canva/courses/IntroToGraphicDesign\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Canva</a></span> opened the doors to graphic design and made it accessible to all. Their open-learning course teaches graphic design principles, like color combinations, image placement, font theories, layouts, and how to apply them in Canva. \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Course cost:</span>&nbsp;Free\n</div> \n<h2>Train your Team&nbsp;and Get More Productive</h2> There you have it, the 47 best ways to train your marketing team. Having the right skills can save your team members a lot of time in their roles, making them more motivated and decrease your company’s attrition rate. Implementing CoSchedule is another great way to save a bunch of time. Learn about how it can help your marketing team get organized by setting up a demo. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84930 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/demo-cta.png\" alt=\"Schedule a demo with CoSchedule CTA.\" width=\"1362\" height=\"661\" /> \n<em>This post was originally created on February 25, 2019. 05:56:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","title":"6 Things You Need To Know About Marketing Management (+ 5 Templates)","link":"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017","description":"<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84207 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/marketing-management-template-header.png\" alt=\"Six things you need to know about marketing management with templates header.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"647\" /> You’ve landed your dream job as a marketing manager. Your 22-year-old self would be so proud. Not only did you find a job in your field,&nbsp;but you also managed to work your way up the ladder. On the other hand, maybe it’s not exactly what you thought it would be — gone are the days of being a “doer”. You’re now responsible for a \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-team/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">team</a>, and your days feel more like this... ↓ \n<img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/d072c811-98a2-430f-990b-d1b89cf8f03b_sponge20bob20fire.gif\" alt=\"Spongebob and fire gif.\" width=\"500\" height=\"375\" /> Than this… ↓ \n<img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/f4e8e6c4-4ff7-4017-90e5-a90455e722cd_spongebob20job.gif\" alt=\"Spongebob &quot;I love my job&quot; gif.\" width=\"480\" height=\"270\" /> Your marketing degree didn’t teach you much about how to deal with the \"actual\" challenges of marketing management. Sure, you learned traditional marketing theories and critical thinking skills, but what about proving ROI on your activities, how to find time to get your own work done, or&nbsp;how to manage all the requests that come in? If you’re feeling a little disgruntled and overwhelmed, this post is for you. This post covers: \n<ul> \n <li>Common IRL marketing management lessons they don’t teach you in school.</li> \n <li>Tips to overcome those challenges.</li> \n <li>A few tools and templates to help you make your way.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\"> \n <a name=\"toc\"></a>\n <strong>Table of Contents</strong> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#intro\">Solve Your Marketing Project Management Woes</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#one\">Lesson 1: Marketing Manager? More Like De Facto Project Manager</a> \n   <ul> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#agile\">The Agile Methodology</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#waterfall\">The Waterfall Methodology</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#compare\">Waterfall vs Agile Methodologies</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#kanban\">Kanban Project View in CoSchedule</a></li> \n   </ul> </li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#two\">Lesson 2: You Rarely Have Time to Do “Real” Work</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#three\">Lesson 3: You Don’t Have to Measure Everything</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#four\">Lesson 4: Marketing Plans Are a Big Lie</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#five\">Lesson 5: Embrace Failure</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#six\">Lesson 6: There’s No “Correct” Answer</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#conclusion\">You're All Set</a></li> \n </ul> &nbsp; \n</div> \n<a name=\"intro\"></a> \n<h2>Solve Your Marketing Project Management Woes</h2> Take a moment to download our marketing project management eBook and five additional work and project management templates to help guide you and your team toward success. Not only will this download make your life as a marketing manager easier, but the guide/templates will help you to untangle any knots management life has created. [Tweet \"Six things you need to know about marketing management.\"] [Cookie \"Get Your Marketing Project Management eBook Templates || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/REPUBLISH_Blog_MarketingManagement-25.png || Download Now || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/marketing-project-management-ebook-templates.zip\"] \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"one\"></a> \n<h2>Lesson 1: Marketing Manager? More Like De Facto Project Manager</h2> You’ve probably heard the \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://betterexplained.com/articles/understanding-the-pareto-principle-the-8020-rule/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">80/20</a></span>\n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://betterexplained.com/articles/understanding-the-pareto-principle-the-8020-rule/\">&nbsp;rule</a></span>, right? It’d be easy to make the mistake that 80% of a marketing manager’s role is focused on marketing and 20% on management. However, most marketing managers find the opposite is true. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84208 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/expectations-vs-reality.png\" alt=\"Expectations vs. reality of marketing managers.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"912\" /> Your team is focused on marketing, but you’re the one fitting all the puzzle pieces together, managing timelines, and shuffling workloads. Not to mention, most of your campaigns require the skills of a certified project manager. If your marketing degree is anything like mine, there wasn’t a single aspect that focused on project management. You’ve probably had to cobble something together that looks vaguely like project management while trying to keep your cool — even when it feels like you’re missing things, and balls are getting dropped. You’re a proverbial duck. Calm on the surface, but paddling like hell underneath to stay afloat. That ends today. Here are two different project management models you can start implementing right now. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"agile\"></a> \n<h2>The Agile Methodology</h2> \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.pmi.org/learning/library/agile-project-management-scrum-6269\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Agile Project Management</a></span>&nbsp;was initially formulated for software development projects, but more and more marketing teams are finding it useful for managing their own projects. The key to managing an \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Agile project</a> is that large marketing campaigns are broken into smaller, more manageable sections. These sections are called \"iterations\" or \"sprints\". Sprints are generally short, running over a few days or weeks. For instance, if you have a marketing campaign that will run the entire duration of Q1, this campaign will be broken down into small iterations. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84209 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/agile-methodology.png\" alt=\"Visual of agile marketing.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"997\" /> \n<h3>Here’s an Example of How to Run a Marketing Project Adhering to Agile Principles:</h3> Your lawn care company is running an early bird promo through the winter to increase business during a slow time. You’ll run the campaign through Q1. The campaign will consist of email marketing, direct mail, tv commercials, radio spots, and social media advertising. \n<h3>Step 1: Set the Vision</h3> To start, the project or marketing manager manager will create a project brief to outline the details of the campaign. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/creative-brief-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Best Way to Write a Creative Brief (Plus Free Templates)</a></span>\n</div> \n<h3>Step 2: Sprint Planning</h3> The team will come together to start \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/sprint-planning/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">spring planning</a>. For our example project, the team would consist of an email marketer, graphic designer, social media advertiser, and perhaps an agency that would be responsible for the TV and radio spots. During this step, team members will be asked about how long each element will take to complete — working backward from the campaign completion date. These timings and individual elements will make up the sprint backlog. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/agile-sprint-planning-for-marketers/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How To Use Agile Sprint Planning To Implement Efficient Marketing Processes</a></span>\n</div> \n<h3>Step 3: Daily Scrums</h3> Production of the campaign begins, and the manager hosts daily standup meetings to track progress and roadblocks. CoSchedule’s team management dashboard is made to facilitate \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/agile-scrum-framework-methodology/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">daily scrums</a>. You’ll see complete visibility into your team’s daily activities — every task, associated with every campaign and what all your team members have on deck for the day. [Tweet \"CoSchedule’s team management dashboard is made to facilitate daily scrums. You’ll see complete visibility into your team’s daily activities.\"] Shifting priorities? No problem. You can easily use the dashboard to reshuffle workloads. Simply drag and drop the task to reassign it. The individual will see the new task pop-up on their daily to-do list. Now, your whole team can turn to CoSchedule first thing in the morning to see what needs to be accomplished for the day. Check it out in action: https://coschedule.wistia.com/medias/t5nah1bdsb?embedType=async&amp;seo=false&amp;videoFoam=true&amp;videoWidth=770 \n<h3>Step 4: Retro</h3> Once the project is completed, a \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/agile-retrospective/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">retroactive</a> meeting is held where the team discusses what went well and what could be improved. This feedback is then used to improve future projects. \n<h3>What are the Benefits of Choosing Agile?</h3> Now that you know what Agile looks like, here are a few benefits to determine if this project management style is right for your \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/cross-functional-marketing-teams/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">team</a>. \n<ol> \n <li>Parts of the campaign can be developed at the same time. For instance, the TV commercial, radio ad, and email marketing can all be developed concurrently to save you.</li> \n <li>It’s flexible and allows for changes based on roadblocks.</li> \n <li>It’s collaborative — daily <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/daily-standup-meeting/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">standups</a> keep all team members in the loop.</li> \n <li>Reduced risk — Agile techniques virtually eliminate the chance of absolute project failure, since issues are addressed in real time.</li> \n</ol> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"waterfall\"></a> \n<h2>The Waterfall Methodology</h2> The \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.pmi.org/learning/library/agile-versus-waterfall-approach-erp-project-6300\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Waterfall project management</a></span> methodology is a sequential, linear process of project management rather than the iterative loop approach in Agile. No phase begins until the prior phase is complete, and the completion of each phase is final — meaning the Waterfall approach does not allow you to return to a previous phase. Think of it like a real waterfall — the water can’t flow upward. The only way to revisit a phase is to start over at phase one. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84210 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/waterfall-methodology.png\" alt=\"Visual of the waterfall methodology.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"608\" /> \n<h3>Here’s an Example of How to Run a Marketing Project Adhering to Waterfall Principles:</h3> Let’s go back to our lawn care marketing example. The campaign will still consist of email marketing, direct mail, tv commercials, radio spots, and social media advertising, but before anything can begin, graphics must be designed. The copy must then be written for the direct mail flyers, which will serve as the creative direction for all the other items. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-project-management-skills/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">8 Marketing Project Management Skills You Need to Lead a Successful Team</a>\n</div> Only after that can the emails be strategized; each item must be completed in a specific order. Should there be changes to the creative direction, you have to return to the graphics phase and start again. \n<h3>What Are the Benefits of Choosing Waterfall?</h3> Why would you want to choose the Waterfall technique? Here’s a short list of some benefits: \n<ol> \n <li>It is simple and straightforward.</li> \n <li>Everything has a start and end, so budgets are easy to follow.</li> \n <li>Team members are less involved and can work on other things until their phase begins.</li> \n</ol> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"compare\"></a> \n<h2>Waterfall vs Agile Methodologies</h2> If you’re still confused about whether you should adhere to Waterfall or Agile, here is a guide to help. \n<h3>Choosing Between Agile and Waterfall</h3> \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84211 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/agile-vs-waterfall.png\" alt=\"Comparison between agile and waterfall marketing.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"1291\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"kanban\"></a> \n<h2>Kanban Project View in CoSchedule</h2> Most marketing managers deal with projects that involve&nbsp;both strategy and execution. Marketers often spend so much time thinking about the strategy, that when it comes to execution, it's easy to resort to a \"just get it done\" mentality. The execution always feels a lot messier and more opaque than it should. You don't know what phase projects are in, nor how close they are to completion... until now. \n<h3>See All Your Project Statuses in One Place With CoSchedule's Kanban View</h3> To get started with the Kanban view, navigate over to the left-hand menu on your CoSchedule calendar. Then choose \n<strong>Projects</strong>. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow alignnone wp-image-83761 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/REPUBLISH_Blog_MarketingManagement-32.png\" alt=\"Kanban view in CoSchedule.\" width=\"1501\" height=\"831\" /> From there, you'll see a card view of custom statuses, so you can see a high-level view of every project and every phase they are in. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-66236\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/ProdBlog_Kathryn_Kanban-1-1.png\" alt=\"Card view statuses in Kanban view.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"586\" /> You can group the Kanban view by three different ways: \n<ol> \n <li>Color label</li> \n <li>Status</li> \n <li>Team member</li> \n</ol> To change the grouping, click the drop-down menu in the top menu. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-66237\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/kanban-sort.gif\" alt=\"Gif of clicking the drop-down menu.\" width=\"1014\" height=\"469\" /> &nbsp; Ready to progress your project in the workflow? Simply drag and drop the project, and it automatically changes its status, color label, or team member. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-66238\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/kanban-move-1.gif\" alt=\"Gif of dragging and dropping projects.\" width=\"1008\" height=\"467\" /> What to know more? Check out this nifty video. https://coschedule.wistia.com/medias/hjsa4uxv1m \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"two\"></a> \n<h2>Lesson 2: You Rarely Have Time to Do “Real” Work</h2> Welcome to the world of marketing management — constant barrage of admin, endless email threads, scavenging through that spreadsheet trying to plan next quarter’s activities, and all&nbsp;while hounding your team to get status updates on current projects. This is a reality they didn’t teach you in your “MRKT 450 – Marketing Management” class. Here are some best practice tips to get more time in your day. [Tweet “How to conquer everything they didn’t teach you about marketing management in school.”] \n<h3>Templatetize Your Workflows</h3> Why reinvent the wheel every time you launch a new project when you can just apply a template? Try creating a workflow template for each project to save yourself time. With CoSchedule, you can create your \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/agile-workflow/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">workflow</a> once and apply it to all future projects. Tasks will be automatically assigned and due dates populated like magic. In CoSchedule, open a new project. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow alignnone wp-image-83762 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/REPUBLISH_Blog_MarketingManagement-30.png\" alt=\"Using a template for creating a workflow.\" width=\"1501\" height=\"831\" /> From here, select the task template icon in the right-hand corner. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow alignnone wp-image-83763 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/REPUBLISH_Blog_MarketingManagement-31.png\" alt=\"Click &quot;templates&quot; for workflow.\" width=\"1501\" height=\"831\" /> Then choose to create a new task template and name it. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-66128\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog_Leah_MarkManagement-3.png\" alt=\"Naming your new task template.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"587\" /> Add all of the tasks that need to be completed before your project can launch. Assign an individual to complete the task and add a due date based on number of days before publish. &nbsp; \n<img class=\"drop-shadow alignnone wp-image-83730 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/image11.png\" alt=\"Adding tasks to your new template.\" width=\"1390\" height=\"1302\" /> You can also add task approvals, so individuals are notified when a task is completed ready for their approval. &nbsp; \n<img class=\"drop-shadow alignnone wp-image-83728 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/image13.png\" alt=\"You can add approval steps in the workflow process.\" width=\"1388\" height=\"1302\" /> Now, you can auto-assign tasks for all future projects with the click of a button. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/bbe1776d-d609-48c7-add7-57b9a31ae509_task-template-default.gif\" alt=\"Gif of auto-signing tasks for future projects.\" width=\"609\" height=\"524\" /> \n<h3>Block Off Time to Get Stuff Done</h3> Marketing managers need to be there for their team members, but sometimes you need to put your head down, turn off all distractions, and get sh*t done. Who would have thought that you would need to book a meeting with yourself just to get your work done? \n<img class=\"aligncenter\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/f3bf9489-545c-4fbb-a62f-0b182f8a9c55_calendar.gif\" alt=\"Gif of calendar.\" width=\"325\" height=\"244\" /> This is the life of a marketing manager, so&nbsp;blocking off time in your calendar means you can devote a few hours a week to focus on nothing else but the task at hand. Whether that’s a slide deck for your CMO, next year’s budget planning, or breaking down last quarter’s results. One tip about this strategy: be transparent with your team. Tell them what you're working on and that you’ll be unavailable for parts of the day. If they know you’re knocking something out, they’ll be more likely to respect your time. \n<h3>Quit Chasing Down Status Updates</h3> No one tells you when you become a marketing manager how challenging it is to get all members of your team on the same page. [Tweet \"No one tells you when you become a marketing manager how challenging it is to get all members of your team on the same page.\"] Not to mention getting people from other marketing departments on the same page. Forget it; that’s an impossible task… or&nbsp;is it? Using a suite of agile marketing software products, like CoSchedule, gives you better visibility into your \"entire\" strategy execution. Every sub-department (like social media, product marketing, demand gen, content marketing, PR, email marketing, etc.) knows what campaigns each other are working on, so you never duplicate work or waste time again. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-asset-management/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Marketing Asset Management: How to Find Everything You Need (Quickly)</a>\n</div> Imagine how much time you would save if you could simply glance at the calendar and know what’s going on daily, weekly, monthly, and quarterly. Here’s an example calendar to get a feeling for what ultimate marketing strategy visibility can look like. \n<img class=\"aligncenter wp-image-66119\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Artboard-16.jpg\" alt=\"Example of the ultimate marketing strategy visibility.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"669\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"three\"></a> \n<h2>Lesson 3: You Don’t Have to Measure Everything</h2> The world of analytics can be overwhelming. There are hundreds of things you are or could be measuring. It’s hard to tell vanity metrics apart from the things that drive \"real\" business value — activity ≠ results. Just because you’re shipping marketing campaigns doesn’t mean you’re driving business results. [Tweet “Marketers often mistake activity with results. Here’s how to fix it.”] Here’s how to fix it. \n<h3>Find Your One Metric That Matters (1MTM)</h3> The 1MTM framework comes down to relentlessly focusing on growing the metric most closely related to growth. It’s your north star, but how do you know \n<span style=\"font-style: italic;\">what</span>&nbsp;\n<span style=\"font-style: italic;\">that</span>&nbsp;\n<span style=\"font-style: italic;\">is</span>? Well, what is your company’s ultimate goal? Let’s say it’s leads… because more leads result in more sales. If you set your sights on 500 leads/month, you have to reverse engineer how to do this and find your 1MTM. What results in more leads? Website traffic. If you only have 2,500 visitors each month, that’s a 20% conversion rate. Probably a little high for most teams to achieve, but you could probably convert 5%, right? That said, you’ll need 10,000 visitors/month to get the 500 leads you’re after, so your 1MTM is website visitors. Your goal is to increase your traffic from 2,500 users to 10,000. Everything your team does should be focused on increasing website visitors. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84212 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/leads-goals.png\" alt=\"Table of goals to increase leads.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"723\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"four\"></a> \n<h2>Lesson 4: Marketing Plans Are a Big Lie</h2> There, I said it. Marketing plans are the worst. They take forever to create, they don’t help you achieve real results, and they promote blind execution. They offer the illusion of due diligence while never contributing much in the way of creativity. If the project were to go pear-shaped, the marketing plan offers binders upon binders of materials to prove you did your homework (i.e. materials to cover your own butt). This means we spend a lot of our time as marketing managers pursuing non-failure rather than results. [Tweet “Is your marketing plan focused on pursuing results or just avoiding failure?”] \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84213 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/moon-quote.png\" alt=\"Quote from Garrett Moon about the unspoken goal of failure.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"646\" /> That plan spells out how often you’re going to blog, publish to social media, and push ad campaigns. It proves all the activities you’re going to do, but&nbsp;activity doesn’t equal results. Marketers are too caught up in bureaucracy. Writing it down feels safe, but the problem with feeling safe is it becomes the goal. The marketing plan in and of itself is the goal, not the \"actual\" results. \n<h3>The Formula to Replace Your Marketing Plan</h3> All you need to start are the three constraints: \n<ol> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">One Metric that Matters</span><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">:</span> The first constraint is laser-beam focus on the one metric that will accelerate your business, like website visitors in the example above.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Goal</span><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">:</span> The second constraint is specificity. Be dead-set on the driver that influenced your 1MTM, like obtaining 500 leads/month in our earlier example.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Timeline</span><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">:</span> The third constraint is speed. Define a clear timeline for when the goal becomes reality. It should give you butterflies (i.e. it’s much shorter than what sounds safe or comfortable).</li> \n</ol> There you have it. The three constraints of your new documented marketing strategy. The tactics remain fluid, so you can #failfast. A combination of both terrifying and refreshing with a dash of agile thinking to top it off. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"five\"></a> \n<h2>Lesson 5: Embrace Failure</h2> Failure isn’t necessarily a bad thing. What’s the best part about failure? It teaches you a valuable lesson about what works and what doesn’t. [Tweet \"What’s the best part about failure? It teaches you a valuable lesson about what works and what doesn’t.\"] Failure means that you’re pushing yourself, taking risks, trying new things, and it gives you the opportunity to improve and try again. Colleges don’t teach you about failure. You’re meant \n<span style=\"font-style: italic;\">not</span>&nbsp;to fail. In the real world, failure is inevitable. That Facebook live video series you thought would push \n<em>x</em> number of visitors to your site flopped, or maybe that holiday sale campaign didn’t bring in as many customers as you wanted. That. Is. Okay. You’ve tried something new, learned it didn’t work, and you can adjust for next time. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84214 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/embrace-failure.png\" alt=\"The cycle of embracing failure.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"1064\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"six\"></a> \n<h2>Lesson 6: There’s No “Correct” Answer</h2> In a lot of industries, there’s a “correct” answer. In medicine, if you have a broken arm, the correct answer is to set the bone and cast it. In school, there’s a correct answer. That scan-tron form expects you&nbsp;to fill out the “correct” bubble to get the answer right. In IRL marketing, however, there’s more than one way to skin a cat. For example, a colleague and I were just discussing whether or not to release a podcast over the holiday break. At first blush, you may think, “Don’t do it; people are with their families and won’t be listening to podcasts,” but some people might be traveling — the perfect time to tune into a podcast. They might even be taking advantage of some extra time off by heading to the gym (also, not a bad time to listen to a podcast). You see, in marketing, there are plenty of creative and useful answers. You might just find that holiday episode of your podcast crushed it, or you might find that it tanked. Either way, you’ll know for next year. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-84215 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/godin-quote.png\" alt=\"Quote from Seth Godin about right and wrong answers.\" width=\"1360\" height=\"646\" /> If you hold out waiting for the “correct” answer, you’ll become paralyzed and will never move forward. Stop waiting for the correct answer to show itself; it likely doesn’t exist. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=66017#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"conclusion\"></a> \n<h2>You're All Set</h2> Now that you have your templates, ebook, and other tactics on how to tidy up the mess marketing management can make, it's time to take action. Get out there and be the best marketing manager for you and your team. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/what-is-marketing-resource-management/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">What Is Marketing Resource Management (and How Can It Help You Defeat Daily Stress)?</a>\n</div> \n<div> \n <em>This post was originally published on January 9, 2019. It was updated and republished on July 8, 2020.</em> \n</div>\n<p>The post <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-management/\">6 Things You Need To Know About Marketing e.com/uploads/2020/07/REPUBLISH_Blog_MarketingManagement-30.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn39@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-56-36-033_4544d0e67c2965d6.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/REPUBLISH_Blog_MarketingManagement-31.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn31@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-38-455_a60b0b51130276c1.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog_Leah_MarkManagement-3.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn3@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-56-36-659_036a6aed2415824d.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/image11.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn16@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-56-38-997_3d0c0561421900f3.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/image13.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn87@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-56-40-359_aa379aca682e55d3.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/bbe1776d-d609-48c7-add7-57b9a31ae509_task-template-default.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn15@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-56-33-424_98fd9fec1425496b.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/f3bf9489-545c-4fbb-a62f-0b182f8a9c55_calendar.gif":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn88@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-38-211_07cf5b7720704024.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Artboard-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn64@2020_3/2020/08/24/21-56-27-528_6a4fcfc786dfa229.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/leads-goals.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn99@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-56-41-709_e2d319dd7f47da19.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/moon-quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn27@2020_4/2020/08/24/21-56-31-864_dd5c683fbe9412cb.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/embrace-failure.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn16@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-31-448_53e9e0cc218386d2.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/07/godin-quote.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn60@2020_1/2020/08/24/21-56-39-502_cc2413db3e64fc44.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598306169508},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","title":"How to Write a Powerful Case Study That Converts Leads Into Customers With 60 Examples and 7 Templates","link":"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603","description":"<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85696 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/powerful-case-study-header-templates.gif\" alt=\"How to write a powerful case study with 60 examples and 7 templates (header)\" width=\"1360\" height=\"540\" /> Case studies are effective tools for converting leads into customers. They help establish your brand as a topical authority, demonstrate how your product solved a real problem for a customer, and help leads see how they could experience similar success with your services. What makes this such an effective content format? Consider the following points: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>They directly position your product as the best solution</strong>. There's a lot of debate around whether or not content should directly sell products. In this case, the answer is \"yes\".</li> \n <li><strong>Your claims are backed up by real results</strong>. Who can argue with data from a real-life scenario?</li> \n <li><strong>Not everyone is creating them</strong>. While blog posts are a dime a dozen, an effective customer story is much harder to duplicate.</li> \n</ul> However, they take time and effort to put together. Fortunately, you can streamline the entire process with this post. You'll learn: \n<ul> \n <li>Everything you need to know about doing effective research.</li> \n <li>A simple, 7-step process for creating case studies from start to finish.</li> \n <li>Tons of examples for inspiration and templates to save you time.</li> \n</ul> Plus, like every type of content or marketing project out there, you can manage the entire workflow on one platform, with CoSchedule. \n<div class=\"callout\"> \n <a name=\"top\"></a>\n <strong>Table of Contents:</strong> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#templates\">Case Study Templates</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#definition\">What is a Case Study?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#examples\">60 Case Study Examples</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#samples\">What Does a Case Study Look Like?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#format\">Formatting</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#writing-steps\">7 Steps to Writing a Case Study</a> \n   <ul> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-1\">Step 1: Finding a Customer to Be Your Subject</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-2\">Step 2: Getting Their Permission</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-3\">Step 3: Creaing an Introductory Questionnaire</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-4\">Step 4: Format Your Case Study Interview Questions</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-5\">Step 5: Schedule the Interview</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-6\">Step 6: Write Your Case Study</a></li> \n    <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#step-7\">Step 7: Promoting Your Case Study</a></li> \n   </ul> </li> \n </ul> \n</div> \n<a name=\"templates\"></a> \n<h2>Create Great Marketing Case Studies With Four Templates</h2> This can be a time-consuming process, so grab this template bundle to streamline your workflow. \n<ul> \n <li><strong>Three Case Study Templates (Word)</strong>: Use this Word template to create a case study you'll either print or make available via PDF. We've included three copies in green, red, and blue header colors.</li> \n <li><strong>Three PowerPoint Templates</strong>: If you would prefer to create a slide deck or presentation, use this PowerPoint template. It's also available in three different color schemes.</li> \n <li><strong>Case Study Template (Web)</strong>: Use this template to write your case study content as a web page.</li> \n</ul> [Cookie \"Get Your Case Study Template Bundle || https://coschedule.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/blog_case-study-V2-23.png || Download Bundle || https://coschedule.com/blog/wp-content/uploads/Case-Study-Templates-1.zip\"] \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#top\">Back to the Top</a>\n</div> \n<a name=\"definition\"></a> \n<h2>What is a Case Study?</h2> According to \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"http://www.toprankblog.com/2013/05/content-marketing-case-studies/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Top Rank Blog</a></span>, a case study is: \n<blockquote>\n An analysis of a project, campaign, or company that identifies a situation, recommended solutions, implementation actions, and identification of those factors that contributed to failure or success.\n</blockquote> \n<div class=\"callout\">\n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/?p=60603#top\">Back to the Top</a>\n</div> \n<a name=\"examples\"></a> \n<h2>60 Marketing Case Study Examples to Inspire Your Own</h2> If you’re looking for an example or two, check out this list of different marketing case studies. \n<ol> \n <li>Patagonia — <a href=\"https://www.ampagency.com/patagonia-fashion-and-footwear-case-study\" target=\"_blank\"
