media editorial calendar header (template)\" width=\"1360\" height=\"580\" /> The best social media marketers keep organized with editorial calendars. They are essential \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-get-organized-at-work/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">organizational tools</a> for strategically planning all the content you’ll create and share. When you work ahead of schedule, you can avoid last-minute scrambling to keep your social media pipeline full, resulting in less stress and better quality content. However, you might have some questions. Those likely include: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>What is a social media editorial calendar, exactly?</strong></li> \n <li><strong>How can bloggers and marketers benefit from using one?</strong></li> \n <li><strong>Are there tools and templates available to make creating them easy?</strong></li> \n</ul> This post will answer all of the above and more. By the time you’re done reading, you’ll understand: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>How to get started using templates and basic knowledge of social strategy.</strong></li> \n <li><strong>How to plan everything from one-off posts to entire campaigns on one calendar.</strong></li> \n <li><strong>How to organize effective scheduling workflows around your calendar.</strong></li> \n</ul> Once you create your calendar, your team will have a single version of truth for your entire social media schedule. Plus, with the template included below, you can get started right now. [Tweet \"How to Effectively Organize Your Social Media Editorial Calendar (Template)\"] \n<h2>Download: Social Media Editorial Calendar Template</h2> This post will show you exactly how to use this downloadable template and CoSchedule’s Marketing Calendar for planning and organizing your entire social schedule. If you’re looking for a convenient way to get started at no cost, snag this simple Excel file now, which you can upload to Google Sheets or Office 365 for team collaboration purposes. [Cookie \"Get Your Social Media Editorial Calendar Template || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/Blog_Social-Media-Editorial-Calendar-10.png || Download Template || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/social_media_editorial_calendar_template.xlsx\"] \n<div class=\"link-callout\"> \n <a name=\"toc\"></a>\n <strong>Table of Contents</strong> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#calendar\">What is a Social Media Editorial Calendar?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#benefits\">The Benefits of Getting Organized and Planning Ahead</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#who\">Who Can Use a Social Calendar?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#intro\">An Introduction to Your Basic Calendar Template</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#good\">What Makes Up a Good Social Media Calendar?</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#planning\">Planning Your Content Strategy</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#plan\">Plan Your Social Media Content Creation Workflow</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#tips\">Three Tips to Keep Your Social Media Calendar Full</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#time\">It's Time to Get Your Social Media Calendar in Order</a></li> \n </ul> \n</div> \n<a name=\"calendar\"></a> \n<h2>What is a Social Media Editorial Calendar?</h2> Here’s a working definition this post will use: \n<blockquote>\n Social media editorial calendars are spreadsheets or apps used to schedule social posts in advance. They’re also used to plan when and which content will be shared, manage campaigns, and track deadlines.\n</blockquote> They’re typically built using one of three different formats: printed paper, spreadsheets, or software services. \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Paper Calendars</span>: The old-school approach for those who prefer hand-written organization.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Spreadsheets</span>: A cost-effective route for planning posts ahead of time.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Software Services</span>: The professional option with powerful automation and time-saving capabilities.</li> \n</ul> Spreadsheets are workable solutions at first and are a great option when you’re starting out. When your social media marketing operations mature though, a holistic software suite, like CoSchedule — which brings social into focus alongside all other projects and campaigns — is the best option. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"benefits\"></a> \n<h2>The Benefits of Getting Organized and Planning Ahead</h2> There are tons of reasons to use a social media calendar. Before you invest the time into building one though, you probably want to know what the real benefits are. Here are four key things to consider: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Turning chaos into harmony</span>. Managing multiple social media accounts can turn messy fast. That kind of disorganization will kill your efficiency.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Holding teams accountable</span>. Calendars are great for setting deadlines. It’s easy to procrastinate when deadlines are flexible or nonexistent. Laying out a clear plan eliminates excuses for not knowing what content to publish on your social channels.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Saving time that you can use to get real work done</span>. No one ever has enough time. However, planning your social media outreach with a calendar lets you make the most of the time you have.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Measurably improving your results</span>. This is the benefit that supersedes all other benefits. After all, efficiency without effectiveness really just means doing things poorly, quickly.</li> \n</ul> Those are some anecdotal benefits, but what about some hard numbers on the benefits of getting organized in general? In the company’s early days, Nathan Ellering, our Head of Marketing, gathered data on what happened when he used a calendar to schedule multiple social posts promoting a single piece of content. Here are the results: \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85729 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/social-media-calendar-example.png\" alt=\"Real-life examples of social media calendars\" width=\"1360\" height=\"3838\" /> 3,150% increase in clicks. Best of all, there’s no reason you can’t replicate similar success, too. What does this mean for you? Getting organized and proactively planning your work are shown to improve results, and calendars are one of the best tools available to support both of those aims. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"who\"></a> \n<h2>Who Can Use a Social Calendar?</h2> Anyone creating social content — whether for a business, media company, or a serious blog — should consider using a calendar. \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Marketing teams</span>: Marketing campaigns often have a lot of moving parts, including social components. Keeping teams organized and making sure everyone involved in a project understands the social promotion schedule is key.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Small businesses</span>: Staying organized with a calendar makes it much easier to save time and maintain consistency. This is important for small businesses, where resources are limited.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Consultants</span>: Getting all of your clients organized with their own calendar can help tame the chaos of managing multiple accounts.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Media companies</span>: If you’re creating editorial content, it’ll need social media promotion. Keep it all together on your calendar.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Bloggers</span>: If your blog is your business, you don’t have time to waste with dysfunctional tools. Make sure every post gets promoted on your calendar.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"intro\"></a> \n<h2>An Introduction to Your Basic Calendar Template</h2> If you’ll be using the template included in this post, it’ll be helpful to understand exactly how it works. Both this template and CoSchedule will be used as examples throughout the instruction here. \n<h3>1. The Broad and General Calendar</h3> You’ll need an overarching calendar to help you focus on topics that matter to your audience. For content marketers, it would be perfect to schedule your broad topic calendar four to six months out. That gives you the opportunity to plan new content based your audience’s reactions. To build your broad and general calendar, start by downloading the social media calendar bundle included in this post. Then, open up the Social Media Calendar Excel file. You’ll find the “Broad and General Calendar” section at the top of the first tab. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72675 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/general-content-calendar-example.png\" alt=\"Example of the general content calendar template\" width=\"1360\" height=\"301\" /> Use the \"Main Theme\" row to map out your primary content themes for each month. Then, fill in sub-topics for content you’ll want to create and share that support those themes. You can base your general calendar on the model from traditional magazines. They typically offer these sorts of editorial calendars for an entire year to attract advertisers for specific magazine issues. \n<h3>2. The Content Calendar</h3> \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72676 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/social-media-content-promotion-calendar-example.png\" alt=\"Example of the social media promotion calendar\" width=\"1360\" height=\"541\" /> The content calendar provides a lot more detail. This is when you look at your topics and plan the actual content types best suited to tell your specific stories — blog posts, e-books, videos, webinars, events, and what-have-you. Let’s look back at the social media calendar you downloaded from this post. Beneath the Broad and General calendar, you’ll find the Content Calendar. This is where you can map out all the content you’ll create, and later share and promote on social media. At this point, you assign the specific dates on which each piece will publish. Typically, you can work two to three months out with this calendar. \n<h3>3. The Promotion Calendar</h3> The promotion calendar is your plan to share all of the content you create. This is when you’ll schedule your social media messages. Using your Social Media Calendar, click into any of the month tabs along the bottom. Here’s what you’ll see: \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72457 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/promotion-calendar-example.png\" alt=\"Example of the promotion calendar\" width=\"1360\" height=\"417\" /> This is where you’ll create and store all your social media promotion content. Here’s what you should put in each field: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Content</span>: This is your social media post copy.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Image Link</span>: If your post will have an image or video, upload it to a cloud storage service (such as Google Drive or Dropbox). Then, drop a link to the image here. This will give you easy access to your images when you’re ready to create your posts.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">URL</span>: If a post will include a link, drop it in here.</li> \n</ul> You can then assign dates when you’ll share each of these messages, which usually takes place immediately after you’re done creating the content you’ll share, but you can plan ahead of schedule with the right tools. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"good\"></a> \n<h2>What Makes Up a Good Social Media Calendar?</h2> It seems like a lot of content marketers&nbsp;create great content, share it when it goes live, and then they&nbsp;call it good.&nbsp;\n<em>They’re all missing out</em>&nbsp;on their own 3,150% more click-throughs. Instead of taking this minimalist approach, a great social media calendar maximizes exposure of your content on the social networks your audience uses — without being spammy. As you plan your content, these eight&nbsp;things can make or break your social media calendar. \n<h3>1. Understand Why Your Audience Shares Your Content</h3> Once you understand the&nbsp;\n<a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/why-people-share/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">psychology of why your audience shares</a>, you can create content in ways that are most likely to connect with them. This will help you plan awesome content from the get-go, and help you interact/socialize with your audience using social media. A report from&nbsp;\n<em>The New York Times</em>&nbsp;Customer Insight Group found five major reasons why people share content with their networks: \n<ol> \n <li>84% share to support a cause.</li> \n <li>78% share to&nbsp;stay connected with those they know.</li> \n <li>69% share to feel involved in the world.</li> \n <li>68% share to define&nbsp;themselves.</li> \n <li>49% share for entertainment or to provide valuable content to others.</li> \n</ol> \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85730 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/5-sharing-lessons.png\" alt=\"5 lessons sharing can teach you\" width=\"1360\" height=\"2645\" /> The study also found that 73% of the survey takers shared content to understand the information more thoughtfully. As you can imagine, there are a lot of lessons to learn from this knowledge. As you plan your social media calendar, keep this in mind. \n<h3>Help Them Define Themselves</h3> Create content about your different&nbsp;\n<a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/google-analytics-reports/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">customer types</a> and help them self-identify. That will help you — and help them — connect with your content. \n<h3>Help Them Connect With Others</h3> Imagine the possibilities a forum — or even a larger brand ambassador program — could present for your customers to ask each other questions and learn from one another. You could even start as simple as a \n<a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/twitter-chat/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Twitter chat</a>. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong>&nbsp;\n <a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-engagement-tactics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">21 Social Media Engagement Tactics That Will Grow Your Audience</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Value Them, and Let Them Know It</h3> If someone sends you a message, leaves you a comment, responds to a tweet — whatever it is — let them know that you valued their contribution. \n<a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-listening/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Listen</a>&nbsp;and respond. \n<h3>Help Them Believe in Something</h3> Again, let your advocates know you appreciate their respect. They’re your rock stars, and almost&nbsp;nothing is better than social proof. While some of this is more about creating awesome content in the first place,&nbsp;\n<em>this is the backbone on which you’ll build your social media calendar.</em> However, without sharing good content in the first place, why would anyone want to interact with you? \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"planning\"></a> \n<h2>Planning Your Content Strategy</h2> Before you can start sharing content, you need to know what you’ll be creating, and why you’ll be creating it. To do this, start with developing a basic content strategy. Planning a content strategy can get complex, but you can keep it simple when you’re starting out. At a very basic level, this process entails determining a few things: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Core topical focus areas</span>. What problems does your content solve and which topics will you focus on?</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Channels you’ll use to communicate that message</span>. Where will you create and share content?</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Content types you’ll create</span>. Blog posts, email newsletters, social campaigns, videos, and so forth.</li> \n</ul> This will be sufficient to get you started. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-content-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Develop a Winning Social Media Content Strategy (Template)</a></span>\n</div> \n<h3>Brainstorming Editorial Ideas</h3> Everything starts with ideas, and you’ll need a lot of them to fill your calendar. One way to generate tons of ideas quickly is to hold a 30-minute brainstorming meeting. The goal is to get as many solid ideas out of your head and onto the calendar as quickly as possible. Here’s how it works: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Spend ten minutes writing down ideas on Post-It notes</span>. As many ideas as you can come up with.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Spend another ten minutes scoring those ideas on a three-point scale</span>. 3’s are surefire hits, 2’s are maybe’s, and 1’s are duds. You’ll likely have several ideas in all three categories, and that’s normal.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Finally, wrap up the meeting with ten minutes of sorting through your 3’s</span>. These are your best ideas that are most likely to succeed.</li> \n</ul> By the time you’re done, you’ll have plenty of ideas to fill up a month or two on your calendar. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/content-marketing-brainstorming-process/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Best 30-Minute Content Marketing Brainstorming Process</a></span>\n</div> \n<h3>Develop a Blog Publishing Cadence</h3> The odds are strong that at least some of your social media content will be sourced from your blog, and if you have a blog at all, integrating your blogging and social strategies is crucial for ensuring the success of each. Blogging is core to your overall content strategy, start here. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85731 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/beginner-blog-schedule.png\" alt=\"Example of a beginner blog schedule\" width=\"1360\" height=\"2645\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/plan-a-blog-schedule/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Plan a Blog Schedule That Will Crush Your Goals</a></span>\n</div> \n<h3>Next, Figure Out How Often You’ll Share Each Post</h3> For each blog post you create, establish a basic publishing schedule to ensure it gets some social traction. While constraints on organic reach have made sharing blog content more difficult, it isn’t impossible to succeed with some smart strategy and creative messaging. Here’s a sample schedule to start with, and it has proven successful for CoSchedule. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85732 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/sm-posting-schedule.png\" alt=\"Posting schedule example for social media\" width=\"1360\" height=\"3671\" /> \n<h3>Establishing a Social Media Publishing Cadence</h3> You’ll likely be creating social media posts to promote content other than blog posts too. You’ll probably be creating content exclusively for social media too, with no outbound links; just awareness-driven content. Now, “How often should I post on social media?” is one of the most common questions we at CoSchedule. It’s a fundamental problem that everyone faces when they’re starting out, and one that has a tendency to nag at even experience marketers and bloggers. There isn’t a single correct answer to that question either. The best approach, then, is to use some research-backed starting points, and then adjust according to your own results from there. Here’s a quick visual reference to begin with. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85733 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/how-often-sm.png\" alt=\"How often you should post on your social media\" width=\"1360\" height=\"8364\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-often-to-post-on-social-media/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How Often to Post on Social Media [Proven Research From 14 Studies]</a></span>\n</div> \n<h3>Aligning Messaging With Appropriate Social Channels</h3> Different types of messaging and content do better on different social networks. This means you might not need to be everywhere or include every channel possible on your calendar. It also means you’ll need to consider which content to share on which platforms. What this looks like specifically will depend on what types of content you create, what topics you’re focused on, where your audience is most active, and myriad other factors. As a starting point, consider these strengths, and use cases for each popular social network. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85734 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/what-content-works.png\" alt=\"Figuring out what content works for social networks\" width=\"1360\" height=\"1225\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"plan\"></a> \n<h2>Plan Your Social Media Content Creation Workflow</h2> Now, let's explore how to use the calendar step-by-step. Follow along to plan out an entire social media marketing workflow for your team or yourself, all based around\n<span style=\"font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen-Sans, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif; font-size: 16px;\"> your calendar.</span> \n<h3>Step 1: Determine What You'll Be Creating or Sharing</h3> Let's begin with a hypothetical social media campaign. Maybe you're promoting: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>A <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/blog-post-templates/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">blog post</a> or article</strong></li> \n <li><strong>A <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-write-landing-pages/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">landing page</a></strong></li> \n <li><strong>An event</strong></li> \n <li><strong>A contest</strong></li> \n <li><strong>A brand or product, in general</strong></li> \n</ul> Whatever the case may be, knowing what you'll be promoting, creating, or sharing is likely where your process will start. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-campaign-ideas/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Generate Better Social Media Campaign Ideas Like a Creative Genius</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Step 2: Write Your Post Copy</h3> As our own Nathan Ellering recently said on our blog: \n<blockquote>\n Think of each message as a&nbsp;\n <a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-write-a-call-to-action-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">call to action</a>: \n <ul> \n  <li>Sell your followers on <em>the value they’ll get</em> if they just click through to read your blog post.</li> \n  <li>Or make them <em>question a current belief</em> with the promise of a better solution to a problem.</li> \n  <li>Or make them feel like <em>they’re missing out</em> on something amazing.</li> \n </ul> \n</blockquote> In short, \n<em>words have power</em>. Wield them intentionally to invoke the emotional response you want. Getting this right is key to driving engagement and traffic. W\n<span style=\"font-family: -apple-system, BlinkMacSystemFont, 'Segoe UI', Roboto, Oxygen-Sans, Ubuntu, Cantarell, 'Helvetica Neue', sans-serif;\">hat are some of the specific types of messaging that you can try out?</span> \n<div class=\"callout\"> \n <ul> \n  <li><strong>Questions</strong>. Close-ended questions drive more clickthroughs. However, open-ended questions may drive more engagement, since you're asking for a response.</li> \n  <li><strong>Benefits</strong>. Hint at what's in it for your audience to click through on your link.</li> \n  <li><strong>FOMO</strong>. Otherwise known as \"the fear of missing out.\"&nbsp;This angle can work well if&nbsp;you're giving your audience a deadline to act.</li> \n  <li><strong>Stats</strong>. Numbers that seem hard-to-believe (but are accurate), can be a great way to stoke interest.</li> \n  <li><strong>Facts</strong>. Again, the harder to believe, the better.</li> \n  <li><strong>Controversy</strong>. This doesn't mean to be offensive. It means don't be afraid of questioning status quo. If you have a contrary opinion on a topic, put it out there. You just might spark a discussion that changes what folks consider common wisdom, which isn't always wise.</li> \n </ul> \n</div> [Tweet \"Wield your words intentionally to invoke the emotional response that you want.\"] If you don't want to write your posts directly into your spreadsheet, use in a word processor (Word, Google Docs, or anything else you prefer will work). Lay out your document like this: \n<p style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><strong>Network:</strong> [INSERT NETWORK] <strong>Post 1 Copy:</strong> [ENTER POST] <strong>Post 1 Image:</strong> [INSERT IMAGE DIRECTION] <strong>Post 1 Link:</strong> [INSERT URL]</p> \n<p style=\"padding-left: 30px;\"><strong>Post 2 Copy:</strong> [ENTER POST] <strong>Post 2 Image:</strong> [INSERT IMAGE DIRECTION] <strong>Post 2 Link:</strong> [INSERT URL]</p> Continue until you've completed a full campaign's worth of posts. To make sure each post is the best it can be before publishing, run your copy through the&nbsp;\n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/social-message-optimizer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Social Media Optimizer.</a> Start by typing in your post copy. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72447 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/enter-social-post-copy.png\" alt=\"Writing a social media post in the Social Message Optimizer\" width=\"1360\" height=\"747\" /> Select&nbsp;\n<strong>Score My Message</strong>, and your score for each social channel will appear. For a more detailed breakdown, scroll along the top bar to switch between channels. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72448 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/social-message-optimizer-score-example.png\" alt=\"Scoring a post with the Social Message Optimizer\" width=\"1360\" height=\"552\" /> Scroll down for more detailed analysis. You'll find tips to improve your post, including recommendations for character counts, hashtags, emotional sentiment, and emojis. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72449 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/smo-score.png\" alt=\"Social Media Optimizer Score\" width=\"1360\" height=\"781\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-write-for-social-media/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Write for Social Media to Create the Best Posts</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Step 3: Hand Off Your Campaign for Design</h3> Next, hand off your image ideas to your designer. You'll likely need to discuss your ideas with them and get their creative input before they begin design. For the sake of example, let's say this is an image we'll use for our campaign: \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72422 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/example-social-photo-dog.jpg\" alt=\"Example photo for blog post\" width=\"1360\" height=\"906\" /> Now that you've got a graphic, upload them to a folder in a cloud-based storage service of your choice (Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.). Give the folder a name specific to this campaign. Then, upload all your images. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72435 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/create-new-folder-1.png\" alt=\"Create a New Folder\" width=\"1360\" height=\"552\" /> Do this for each photo in your campaign. That way, you'll have easy access to all your campaign's assets when you're ready to post them. Alternately, CoSchedule customers can use the \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-suite/asset-organizer\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Asset Organizer</a>. It's a digital asset management system built specifically for marketers that makes it easy to keep visual assets organized. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72438 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/asset-organizer-example.png\" alt=\"Example of CoSchedule's Asset Organizer\" width=\"1360\" height=\"738\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-images/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Make the Best Social Media Images the Easy Way</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Step 4: Add All Your Campaign Content Onto Your Calendar</h3> Now, you have all the content for your campaign ready. It's time to place it all on the calendar. Start by pasting in your post copy. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72439 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/write-post-copy-template.png\" alt=\"Writing social post copy\" width=\"1360\" height=\"214\" /> Then, grab the URL for the image from your image storage service and paste that in, too. If you're using Google Drive, click the \"Get Shareable Link\" button below. Then, paste that URL into your calendar. This will make the image easily accessible later. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72440 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/share-image-example.png\" alt=\"Example of sharing an image from Google Drive\" width=\"1360\" height=\"754\" /> Finally, add in the time for your post: \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72442 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/add-time.png\" alt=\"Add social media post time\" width=\"1360\" height=\"169\" /> Repeat as necessary until you've entered all your content. Follow this same process for every post you create. Use the text wrap settings in Google Sheets or Excel to control how content fills each cell in your calendar. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72446 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/use-text-wrap-google-sheets.png\" alt=\"Using Text Wrap in Google Sheets\" width=\"1360\" height=\"235\" /> \n<span style=\"color: #ff9900;\"><span style=\"color: #000000;\">Alternately, you can do this all in CoSchedule, too.</span>&nbsp;<span style=\"color: #000000;\">With the Social Organizer, you can easily create single posts or entire campaigns. Plus, you can keep all your copy and images neatly organized, reshare top-performing posts automatically with ReQueue, and optimize post timing with Best Time Scheduling.</span></span> https://coschedule.wistia.com/medias/uszpz02w5v?embedType=async&amp;videoFoam=true&amp;videoWidth=770 \n<h3>Step 5: Measure Your Results</h3> Once you start using your calendar, you'll want to see results, right? One way to do that is to measure referral traffic to your blog or website using Google Analytics. On the first tab of the calendar template included in this post, you'll see this link to a Custom Report template for Google Analytics: \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72450 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/where-to-find-ga-custom-report-link.png\" alt=\"Where to find your Google Analytics custom report link\" width=\"1360\" height=\"123\" /> Copy and paste this URL into your browser. Next, you'll see a screen that looks like this: \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72451 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/set-up-custom-report-1.png\" alt=\"Setting up the custom report\" width=\"1360\" height=\"635\" /> Under \"Select A View,\" choose which site associated with a Google Analytics account you'd like to use. Then, you'll see your social media traffic dashboard. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow aligncenter wp-image-72453 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/social-media-traffic-2.png\" alt=\"Review social media traffic in Google Analytics\" width=\"1360\" height=\"781\" /> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/social-media-analytics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">How to Use Social Media Analytics to Create the Best Content</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Using Social Analytics in CoSchedule</h3> To automate your social media measurement, consider using \n<a href=\"https://help.coschedule.com/hc/en-us/sections/115000738394-Social-Analytics\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Social Analytics in CoSchedule</a>. You can track engagement rates, post-level performance metrics, compare campaigns side-by-side, and more (with exportable reports). http://coschedule.wistia.com/medias/mdmif55fyv?embedType=async&amp;seo=false&amp;videoFoam=true&amp;videoWidth=770 \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"tips\"></a> \n<h2>Three Tips to Keep Your Social Media Calendar Full</h2> Keeping your calendar full of content might not seem easy. But, there are some ways to maintain consistency without exhausting your team by exclusively creating fresh posts. \n<h3>Re-share Your Top-Performing Posts</h3> Space out similar messaging on different days and post at different times. When a particular post does well, consider resharing it on an ongoing basis on your calendar. If you're a CoSchedule customer, \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/requeue\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">ReQueue</a> makes this easy to automate. https://coschedule.wistia.com/medias/q9upl3u2kz?embedType=async&amp;videoFoam=true&amp;videoWidth=770 \n<h3>Curate Content</h3> Add useful links to posts from other blogs and sites your audience will enjoy. You can pre-select these in advance, or simply leave a note to find something that's trending on a given day, which may be difficult to predict. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85735 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/curation-schedule.png\" alt=\"How to put together a curation schedule for social media\" width=\"1360\" height=\"7107\" /> If you're using CoSchedule, be sure to grab our \n<a href=\"https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/coschedule/cojlloeohkdmongfddeggmplibjannea?hl=it\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Chrome extension</a>. It makes curating content from anywhere on the web easy. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"http://coschedule.com/blog/?p=25836#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"time\"></a> \n<h2>It's Time to Get Your Social Media Calendar in Order</h2> No matter which solution you choose, it's important to get your social media efforts organized. Your calendar is a key part of that equation. Let's recap what we've covered: \n<ul> \n <li><strong>You now understand the benefits of using a social media editorial calendar</strong>. It's a key tool for keeping organized, staying efficient, and maximizing your effectiveness.</li> \n <li><strong>You now know how to build a social media calendar</strong>. It's easy to put one together with a spreadsheet, or use the downloadable template we've included in the download.</li> \n <li><strong>You also know how to fill in your calendar</strong>. Not only that, but you now know when to post at optimal times.</li> \n <li><strong>You get the importance of mixing up your messages</strong>. Use the right type of message to get the right kind of response you want.</li> \n <li><strong>Finally, you understand how to test your results and adjust your approach accordingly</strong>. Data doesn't lie, and it's vital to driving maximum traffic and engagement.</li> \n</ul> Start with this template. Then upgrade to the industry's best all-in-one social media calendar. \n<a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-suite/social-organizer\"><img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85450 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/Blog_Social-Media-Editorial-Calendar_REPUBLISH-09.png\" alt=\"\" width=\"1360\" height=\"580\" /></a> \n<em>This post was originally published on May 18th, 2016. Organize Your Social Media Editorial Calendar (Template)</a> appeared first on <a rel=\"nofollow\" href=\"https://coschedule.com\">CoSchedule Blog</a>.</p>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 24 Aug 2020 14:51:29 .com/uploads/2020/08/curation-schedule.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn48@2020_5/2020/08/24/21-56-39-179_7d3d5ccb4d04a81c.webp","https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/Blog_Social-Media-Editorial-Calendar_REPUBLISH-09.png":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn43@2020_6/2020/08/24/21-56-25-226_d9c8923b43a02b28.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1598306169437},{"createdTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","updatedTime":"2020-08-25 05:56:09","title":"Marketing Education: 50+ Resources to Level Up Your Skills","link":"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605","description":"<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85174 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/marketing-education-resources-header.png\" alt=\"Marketing education: 50+ resources to level up your skills header.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"585\" /> The global marketing industry is estimated to be worth a massive \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/zarkodimitrioski/2019/02/13/how-much-money-is-in-the-global-marketing-industry-more-than-we-believed/#29e4a30017c3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">$1.7 trillion</a></span>. It’ll come as no surprise to learn that marketing is becoming a popular career path. Businesses are ploughing money into marketing campaigns to reach their target customers in a world overrun with advertising, and they need to employ marketers to do it. When you want to start working in the marketing industry, you need a lot of background knowledge. In this guide, we’ll bust the myth that you need to get your knowledge through a traditional degree. Instead, we’ll show you how to learn marketing yourself, with 50+ incredible resources to get you going. [Tweet \"Marketing education: 50+ resources to level up your skills.\"] \n<h2>What Does “Marketing Education” Mean?</h2> Before we get into the resources, let’s be clear on what “marketing education” actually means. \n<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Marketing education is how you’ll build skills and knowledge to get a job in the marketing industry. </span> Your skills and knowledge can either be self-taught or come in the form of a qualification — such as a marketing degree. Regardless of how you get them, most employers will need some \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-skills/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">marketing skills</a></span>, experience, and education when hiring for a role. \n<img class=\"drop-shadow alignnone wp-image-85175 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/marketing-skills.png\" alt=\"50 marketing skills you need to succeed in 2020.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"5114\" /> \n<h2>Do I Need a College Degree to Work in Marketing?</h2> The traditional route to getting a job is to go to college for qualifications. Unlike training for other job roles, like a doctor, you don’t always need a qualification to \n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/how-to-get-a-marketing-job/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">get a marketing job</a></span>. There are plenty of companies that hire marketers based on their practical skills, rather than an official qualification. That being said, there are pros and cons to getting an official marketing degree. Let’s break them down. \n<h3>Pros of Getting a Marketing Degree</h3> Sometimes, a marketing degree can be worth it. Let’s take a look at the benefits of getting one: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">They’re recognized by employers</span>: Take a look at some marketing job descriptions, and you’ll see that most ask for a marketing-related qualification. Some employers look for this because it proves you’ve got a solid understanding.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">Some marketing courses offer placements</span>: Depending on where you get your degree from, you might have the opportunity to get real-life experiences in the form of a work placement or internship.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">There’s lots of theory</span>&nbsp;<span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">work</span>: You’ll learn why marketing is important, and the strategies and principles behind why we do it.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Listening:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/the-two-things-every-remote-marketing-team-needs-to-succeed-and-how-to-bring-them-together-with-lars-helgeson-from-greenrope-amp-195/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Two Things Every Remote Marketing Team Needs to Succeed (And How to Bring Them Together) With Lars Helgeson From GreenRope [AMP 195]</a>\n</div> \n<h3>Cons of Getting a Marketing Degree</h3> There’s no doubt that getting a marketing degree can be valuable, yet it’s not always the best route to go down if you want to get a marketing job. That’s because: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">It’s <a href=\"https://twitter.com/hayward_timothy/status/1275007729132810241\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">expensive</a></span>: The cost of getting a marketing degree can be <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.allbusinessschools.com/marketing/degrees/#:~:text=The%20cost%20of%20bachelor's%20degree,out%2Dof%2Dstate%20tuition.\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">up to $34,740</a></span>, and that’s before you factor in other college-related costs, like textbooks and housing.</li> \n</ul> \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85176 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/education-costs.png\" alt=\"Average annual costs to attend school for marketing.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"623\" /> \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">It doesn’t always cover things you’ll need on the job</span>: The work you’ll do is very hypothetical. Whilst you’ll know the theory behind everything, it could be a waste of time. You could be learning on the job whilst getting real experience.</li> \n <li><span style=\"font-weight: bold;\">You can’t learn all types of marketing</span>: Thinking of specializing in one type of marketing? You can’t do that with a degree. There are no <a href=\"https://twitter.com/gaetano_nyc/status/1275002531463168002\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">SEO or demand generation</a> qualifications, for example. You’ll just get a top-level view of the entire marketing industry.</li> \n</ul> \n<h2>DOWNLOAD: Learn the Process for Learning New Skills With This Quick eBook</h2> No matter what you're trying to learn, you're more likely to succeed when you have a clear and repeatable process for building new skills. Download this brief but value-packed PDF to develop an easy, 11-step process to teach yourself new skills: [Cookie \"Get Your Marketing Skills eBook || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/blog_Marketing-Education-50-Resources-to-Level-Up-Your-Skills-07.png || Download Now || https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/Learn_Any_Marketing_Skill_pdf_gIlhAITc.pdf.zip\"] \n<h2>50+ Resources to Teach Yourself Marketing</h2> Don’t fancy going down the university route to build your marketing knowledge? You’re in luck. There are thousands of resources you’ve got access to, and they’re all completely free, made by marketers for marketers. We’ve compiled 51 of the best resources you can use to teach yourself marketing. We know that people have different learning styles. Not everyone wants to sit in front of a computer screen, and watch someone else talk you through something. That’s why we’ve broken each marketing resource into different formats. \n<div class=\"link-callout\"> \n <a name=\"toc\"></a>\n <strong>Table of Contents</strong> \n <ul> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#online\">Online Courses</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#books\">Books</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#blogs\">Blogs</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#guides\">Guides</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#youtube\">YouTube Channels</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#podcasts\">Podcasts</a></li> \n  <li><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#email\">Email Newsletters</a></li> \n </ul> \n</div> \n<a name=\"online\"></a> \n<h3>Online Courses</h3> Online courses are one of the best ways to teach yourself marketing if you don’t have tons of spare time. That’s because it packages lots of marketing-related tactics — such as content, SEO, and social media — into one course. [Tweet \"Online courses are one of the best ways to teach yourself marketing if you don’t have tons of spare time.\"] You don’t need bookmarks open for thousands of blog posts. One course can teach you a lot about a specific marketing subject. However, the downside is that most of them aren’t free. You might need to invest a small amount of cash to get access to the course. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85177 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/course-benefits.png\" alt=\"Benefits of taking online marketing courses.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"660\" /> Here are some to start with: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/academy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule Academy</a></span>: Yup, that’s right! We have a library of on-demand, online courses that teach you how to become a better marketer. It’s great for anyone looking to improve their marketing skills, and it even comes with a certification that proves you know what you’re talking about.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.bruceclay.com/seo/search-engine-optimization/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Bruce Clay’s SEO Course</a></span>: Search engine optimization is a form of marketing that prioritizes traffic from search engines, like Google. This course takes you through each stage of SEO — from selecting keywords to target through reporting on your results.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.marketingprofs.com/training/courses\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Marketing Profs</a></span>: Online courses from Marketing Profs&nbsp;tend to be slightly more expensive than the others, but they’re worth the money. They invite experts in to co-teach their courses, which are taught at a higher level than most. It’s a superb option if you want to specialize in one specific marketing area.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.edx.org/learn/marketing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">EDX</a></span>: You don’t actually have to enroll in your local college’s marketing course to teach yourself marketing. EDX takes the curriculum from colleges like Columbia, Berkeley, and UBC, and makes it free to access online. The majority of online courses are self-paced, but there are some real-time courses where lessons are released once a week.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.coursera.org/browse/business/marketing\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Coursera</a></span>: Similar to EDX, Coursera takes marketing courses from popular colleges and universities, and makes them accessible online. Some courses are short and free, but you can also apply to get a marketing degree through their online courses, if you prefer.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://school.copyhackers.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Copyhackers School</a></span>: If you want to build knowledge around the copy side of marketing, this is the course for you. It’s run by conversion copywriting expert, Joanna Wiebe, and has lessons to take you from absolute beginner to copywriting expert.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"books\"></a> \n<h3>Books to Read</h3> Your marketing education shouldn't stop once you’ve taken an online course. [Tweet \"Your marketing education shouldn't stop once you’ve taken an online course.\"] The marketing industry is always changing. New tactics, technologies, and techniques come thick and fast. While a course can teach you the foundations, you should also look to other resources to stay updated. A superb way to do that is through reading marketing books. Experts in the industry write books as a way to share which strategies work and don't work. You can also get a solid insight into how a company actually does their marketing, making your own education less theoretical and more practical. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85178 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/10x-cta.png\" alt=\"CTA for Garrett's 10x book.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"593\" /> Below are some of our favorites: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/10x-Marketing-Formula-Blueprint-Competition-Free-ebook/dp/B0793FQ6DD/ref=sr_1_3?dchild=1&amp;keywords=10x+marketing+formula&amp;qid=1592333919&amp;s=digital-text&amp;sr=1-3\">10x Marketing Formula</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/10x-Marketing-Formula-Blueprint-Competition-Free-ebook/dp/B0793FQ6DD/ref=sr_1_3?dchild=1&amp;keywords=10x+marketing+formula&amp;qid=1592333919&amp;s=digital-text&amp;sr=1-3\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by Garrett Moon</a></span>: The entire concept of this book is to make big moves that get 10x growth, rather than small, marketing tactics that only improve your results by 10%. It’s a must-read if you’re thinking of doing any type of marketing for a startup.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/This-Marketing-Cant-Until-Learn-ebook/dp/B07DBR1V9S/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">This is Marketing</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/This-Marketing-Cant-Until-Learn-ebook/dp/B07DBR1V9S/\">&nbsp;by Seth Godin</a></span>: Authored by one of the most famous marketers, this book is a great starting point for beginners. It covers the basics of marketing: how to connect with the people in which you’re promoting products or services.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Youtility-Smart-Marketing-about-Help-ebook/dp/B00B1FG7VE/\">Youtility</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Youtility-Smart-Marketing-about-Help-ebook/dp/B00B1FG7VE/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by Jay Baer</a></span>: Most marketing resources teach you how to do the actual concept, but this book goes behind the curtain and focuses on one of the most important approaches: being personable. It shows how to make your marketing more user-focused, rather than placing the spotlight on your brand.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Ogilvy-Advertising-David-ebook/dp/B00EMXBZKA/\">Ogilvy on Advertising</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Ogilvy-Advertising-David-ebook/dp/B00EMXBZKA/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by David Ogilvy</a></span>: Known as the “Father of Advertising,” this book, from David Ogilvy, needs to be on your bookshelf if advertising forms part of your marketing strategy. It teaches everything from writing an advert that gets sales to running an advertising agency.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Made-Stick-Ideas-Survive-Others-ebook/dp/B000N2HCKQ\">Made to Stick</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Made-Stick-Ideas-Survive-Others-ebook/dp/B000N2HCKQ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by Chip and Dan Heath</a></span>: Human behavior is the foundation of any marketing campaign. <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">Made to Stick</span> dives into that foundation and explains how to use psychology to get bigger and better results with your marketing strategy.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Content-Inc-Entrepreneurs-Successful-Businesses-ebook/dp/B0141KT528/\">Content, Inc.</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Content-Inc-Entrepreneurs-Successful-Businesses-ebook/dp/B0141KT528/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by Joe Pulizzi</a></span>: Speaking of placing the focus on your customer, this marketing book explains the reader-based side of content marketing. You’ll learn how to find the content your audience actually wants to read and how to write it well.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Everybody-Writes-Go-Creating-Ridiculously-ebook/dp/B00LMB5P0G/\">Everybody Writes</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Everybody-Writes-Go-Creating-Ridiculously-ebook/dp/B00LMB5P0G/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by Ann Handley</a></span>: Writing is a core part of any marketing campaign; it’s how you communicate online. This book teaches you how to do that, whilst also guiding you through the process of writing good content.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Nicely-Said-Writing-Purpose-Voices-ebook/dp/B00KFGCD1I/\">Nicely Said</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Nicely-Said-Writing-Purpose-Voices-ebook/dp/B00KFGCD1I/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">&nbsp;by Nicole Fenton</a></span>: Here’s another bookshelf staple, if you want to build on your writing skills. It’s similar to <em>Everybody Writes</em>, but it also includes advice from writers working for companies like Pinterest, Design Mom, and GOV.UK.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Practical-Content-Strategy-Marketing-Certification-ebook/dp/B077SKLYNT/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Practical Content Strategy and Marketing</a></span><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.amazon.com/Practical-Content-Strategy-Marketing-Certification-ebook/dp/B077SKLYNT/\">&nbsp;by Julia McCoy</a></span>: Authored by a content marketing pro who grew her own multi-million dollar content agency, this book guides you through creating a marketing strategy, step-by-step. It’s more than just a theory book.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-training/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The 47 Best Resources to Train Your Marketing Team</a>\n</div> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"blogs\"></a> \n<h3>Marketing Blogs</h3> You can teach yourself marketing — even if you don’t have money to invest in an online course or marketing book. There are blogs that exist purely for marketers to share their own experiences in the hopes of teaching others. In fact, it’s such a popular way to teach and learn marketing, that there are over 2.8 billion Google search results for “\n<span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.google.com/search?sxsrf=ALeKk01-6XeB9pt46l_lST7vxsqd2ctyLg%3A1593785137585&amp;ei=MTv_XoS2I9CAhbIPwfeEqAk&amp;q=marketing+blog&amp;oq=marketing+blog&amp;gs_lcp=CgZwc3ktYWIQAzIECCMQJzICCAAyAggAMgQIABBDMgIIADIECAAQQzICCAAyAggAMgIIADICCAA6BAgAEEdQ1xBY1xBgiBJoAHABeACAAUWIAUWSAQExmAEAoAEBqgEHZ3dzLXdpeg&amp;sclient=psy-ab&amp;ved=0ahUKEwjEkuWnoLHqAhVQQEEAHcE7AZUQ4dUDCAw&amp;uact=5\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">marketing blog</a></span>”. \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85179 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/2-8-billion.png\" alt=\"2.8 billion search results for &quot;marketing blog&quot; on Google.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"642\" /> To save you time scrolling through all of them, we recommend starting with these: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule Blog</a></span>: That’s right! This blog post you’re reading is part of a library of marketing-related blog posts on the CoSchedule website. We talk about every part of marketing for startup businesses to million dollar brands.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.convinceandconvert.com/blog/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Convince and Convert</a></span>: One of the marketing books we’ve already mentioned was written by Jay Baer. That book came to fruition after his marketing blog gained notoriety. It’s a great alternative to the book if you just want to dive into one specific marketing topic.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://copyblogger.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Copyblogger</a></span>: Here’s a great blog to bookmark if you’re thinking of specializing in the content space. Copyblogger covers everything you need to know about researching, planning, writing, and publishing online content.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://marketingland.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Marketing Land</a></span>: This isn’t necessarily a blog-style website — it’s more of a news site that publishes stories relevant to marketers. It’s a good site to check-in on to stay updated. Bonus: there’s also <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://searchengineland.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Search Engine Land</a></span>, run by the same company, that focuses exclusively on SEO news.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.postplanner.com/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Post Planner</a></span>: Post Planner is actually a social media tool, but their website has a ton of useful blog posts that teach small to midsize companies how to do marketing. It’s a great one to read if you’re relatively new to the industry.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.socialmediaexaminer.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Social Media Examiner</a></span>: They’re one of the biggest social media blogs because they have tons of contributors sharing advice on what’s worked for them. Social Media Examiner also releases an annual report that shares tons of valuable statistics about the industry and hosts events for social media marketers.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.orbitmedia.com/blog-start-here/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Orbit Media Studios</a></span>: Similarly, this is an agency who runs a marketing blog. What’s unique about this marketing blog is that they invest in lots of marketing studies and original research, like this one on <span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.orbitmedia.com/blog/blogging-statistics/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">blogging trends</a></span>.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.siegemedia.com/blog\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Siege Media Blog</a></span>: The team behind Siege Media are smart marketers. They share the results they have for their agency’s clients on their blog. It’s a good source of practical content, based on actual results, like a peek through a marketing agency.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://reallygoodemails.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Really Good Emails</a></span>: Emails are hard to write because they’re so specific. However, you can get some pointers with this email-focused marketing blog. It’s curated thousands of real-life emails, with a breakdown on why they’re good. It’s a superb resource for anyone looking to write marketing emails.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://ipullrank.com/blog/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">iPullRank Blog</a></span>: Here’s a marketing blog to bookmark for when you start getting in the technical side of marketing. There’s a heavy focus on SEO, but most of the principles can apply to other marketing channels.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://unbounce.com/blog/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Unbounce</a></span>: You can have the best marketing tactics in the world, but if nobody is coming to your site, it’s not worth anything. This blog teaches you how to optimize your website, so when people arrive, they don’t exit without converting.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"guides\"></a> \n<h3>Marketing Guides</h3> The beauty of the internet is that you’ve got instant access to content you’d otherwise pay thousands of dollars for. [Tweet \"The beauty of the internet is that you’ve got instant access to content you’d otherwise pay thousands of dollars for.\"] These marketing guides do exactly that. They’re in-depth, written resources that teach you everything you need to know about a specific topic. Similar to an online course, but without the price tag and lesson-style curriculum. Here are some of our favorite marketing guides to help you get started. \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://moz.com/beginners-guide-to-seo\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Moz’s Beginner’s Guide to SEO</a></span>: Search engine optimization is one of the hardest channels to master because it comes with a bunch of terminology. This guide, authored by the SEO geniuses at Moz, walks you through everything you need to know about SEO.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/agile-marketing-guide/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule’s Agile Marketing Guide</a></span>: We’ve already touched on the fact that marketing is constantly changing; that’s why there are blogs dedicated solely to marketing news, and they publish almost daily. As a marketer, you need to have flexibility to take advantage of those changes. Our manual to agile marketing guides you through that.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/marketing-strategy/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">CoSchedule’s Marketing Strategy Guide</a></span>: Do you learn best by reading case studies? You’re not alone. Case studies prove that the marketing tactics you read about actually work. We published the marketing strategy guide that got us 434% more page views, 1,222% more email subscribers, and 9,360% more marketing-qualified leads — so yeah, it works.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://mailchimp.com/resources/mailchimp-101/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Email Marketing 101</a></span>: Mailchimp is a superb email marketing tool that offers a free plan for you to play with when you’re starting to learn marketing. Combined with this email marketing guide, you’re armed with tons of information and a free tool for you to practice sending marketing emails.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"youtube\"></a> \n<h3>YouTube Channels</h3> The marketing resources we’ve shared so far are mainly in written form. If you prefer to learn by watching videos, there are tons of YouTube videos you can browse. They’re regularly updated and easy to watch — making them a superb resource for marketers who want to build their skills and knowledge. Here are some of our favorite YouTube channels for marketers. \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCWquNQV8Y0_defMKnGKrFOQ\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ahrefs</a></span>: Ahrefs have SEO software that has a reasonably high price point for beginners. However, they have a YouTube channel that they fill with tons of high-quality videos about SEO and marketing. They walk you through each topic, step-by-step, so you can follow along.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/behindthebrandTV\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Behind the Brand</a></span>: Ever wanted to go behind the scenes of a business that made their millions through marketing? You can with this YouTube channel. Watch interviews with smart marketers, like Daymond John from Shark Tank, bestselling author Simon Sinek, and singer-songwriter Hayley Williams.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/gogrowtheverywhere\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Eric Siu’s Leveling Up</a></span>: Owner of one of the biggest marketing agencies, Single Grain, Eric Siu’s YouTube channel has videos for marketers at every stage in their education. He’ll guide you through everything from creating a resume to new marketing hacks in which you can experiment.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/user/backlinko\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Backlinko With Brian Dean</a></span>: Brian’s blog has become one of the biggest resources for SEO because he breaks down complex topics into easy-to-digest learning material. His YouTube channel coincides with this.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC2kyfjZNXSPLwUyPYaYPsdg\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Marketing 360</a></span>: Here’s another great option if you want to build your marketing education. You’ll find short, bite-size videos that teach you marketing fundamentals — without needing hours of your time to invest.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCi_h92zNgaLSs8tD5gIm-KA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Jay Baer</a></span>: He’s grown five, multi-million dollar brands, and this YouTube channel shares the marketing tactics he’s used to do it. There are also interviews with other notable marketers you can dive into.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtg49RXJ7nSfEudai4yyDcA\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Ross Simmonds</a></span>: Ross is an international speaker who teaches people how to better their marketing. His YouTube channel is an extension of this. You’ll find fun videos that answer some of your biggest marketing questions, like how to create a funnel and when you should hire writers.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"podcasts\"></a> \n<h3>Marketing Podcasts</h3> Got a 30 minute-long commute? Washing the dishes? Waiting to pick up your kids from school? Instead of mindlessly listening to the radio and dreaming about what you’ll make for your supper, listening to a podcast is a superb way to slot learning into a busy schedule. You can find tons of great podcasts on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or any major podcast platform. They all have varying lengths — from ten minutes up to one hour. You can slot them into any time of your day, and start building your marketing knowledge. \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/marketing-skills/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The 50 Most Essential Marketing Skills You Need to Be Successful in 2020</a>\n</div> Here are nine great marketing podcasts to get you started: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/podcast\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Actionable Marketing Podcast</a></span>: This is the best option if you like intensive, value-packed marketing podcasts. We interview some of the world’s best marketers, including Joanna Weibe, Rand Fishkin, Brian Dean, and Noah Kagan. Grab a notepad before you listen.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.marketingovercoffee.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Marketing Over Coffee</a></span>: If you fancy chatting with a friend about marketing but don’t know anyone in the industry, you’ll love this podcast. It’s hosted by two friends who do what the name suggests: talk about marketing over a cup of coffee. It makes for great, bite-sized listening.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://rainmaker.fm/series/lede/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Copyblogger FM</a></span>: Copyblogger is a marketing blog we’ve already mentioned. The same team also has a weekly podcast that teaches you every element of content marketing and copywriting; the best stuff from their blog packaged into a podcast.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.everyonehatesmarketers.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Everyone Hates Marketers</a></span>: Want to start learning marketing, but don’t like shady tactics? Marketing pro, Louis Grenier, has this podcast to talk about the human side of marketing; one that doesn’t <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">feel</span>&nbsp;like you’re using spammy campaigns to get money from people.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.hubspot.com/podcasts/the-growth-show\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Growth Show</a></span>: Think of a brand with a powerful marketing strategy, and I’m sure HubSpot comes to mind. Their VP of Marketing, Meghan Keaney Anderson, hosts this podcast. It shares everything you would want to know about marketing, for small businesses to million dollar brands (like HubSpot).</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://marketingschool.io/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Marketing School</a></span>: One of the most popular marketing podcasts is Marketing School, hosted by Neil Patel and Eric Siu. Both have their own successful agencies. They come together on this podcast to talk about their best tactics. There are already over 1,400 episodes.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/savvy-social-podcast/id1390672198\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Savvy Social Podcast</a></span>: Need a marketing podcast that’s exclusively about social media? You’ll love this one. It’s hosted by Andréa Jones, and it shares how to make the most out of social platforms for the business you’re marketing.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://adweek.libsyn.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Yeah, That’s Probably an Ad</a></span>: Similarly, this is a great option if you’re looking to build your advertising knowledge. It’s hosted by media giant, AdWeek, and covers trending topics in the industry. Think of it like a news feed for the advertising and technology industry.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://podcast.jennakutcher.com/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Goal Digger</a></span>: Here’s a slightly more niche podcast but worthy of being listed nonetheless. It’s a podcast for female entrepreneurs who need help with their marketing. They cover important topics that’ll help you grow a marketing business rather than just learning the skill.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong><a href=\"https://coschedule.com/?p=84605#toc\">Back to the Top</a></strong>\n</div> \n<a name=\"email\"></a> \n<h3>Email Newsletters About Marketing</h3> You’ll need to learn about email marketing when you’re teaching yourself marketing. Instead of playing around with them yourself, you can subscribe to other marketers’ newsletters. This offers two benefits: \n<ol> \n <li>You can get their best advice that they don’t typically share elsewhere.</li> \n <li>You’ll see what it feels like to be on the receiving end of a good marketing email.</li> \n</ol> \n<img class=\"alignnone wp-image-85180 size-full\" src=\"https://media.coschedule.com/uploads/2020/08/follow-benefits.png\" alt=\"Two benefits of following other newsletters.\" width=\"1361\" height=\"642\" /> Concerned about which newsletters you’re inviting to land in your inbox? You don’t want to see thousands of emails or spam messages every week. We recommend starting with these newsletters: \n<ul> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://pjrvs.com/signup\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sunday Dispatches</a></span>: Paul Jarvis has a unique way of marketing. He doesn’t believe in aggressive, in-your-face marketing that’s obviously trying to sell something. Instead, he prioritizes building relationships and shares his experiences in his weekly newsletter, \"Sunday Dispatches\".</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://workbrighter.co/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Work Brighter</a></span>: Similarly, Brittany Berger doesn’t stand for the “hustle” mentality that most marketers have— burning them out. The \"Work Brighter\" newsletter teaches marketers how to work smarter, not harder.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://carney.co/daily-carnage/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Daily Carnage</a></span>: Need an easy way to find new marketing news? Searching Google every morning or subscribing to hundreds of newsletters probably isn’t the best use of your time. This newsletter compiles the best marketing news and delivers it to your inbox every morning.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://annhandley.com/newsletter/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Total Annarchy</a></span>: Ann Handley, the author of <span style=\"font-style: italic;\">Everybody Writes</span>, also sends a weekly newsletter. You’ll find great tips on how to become a better writer, which has a huge impact on your marketing work. The best part: the entire history of Total Annarchy is available to read now.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.ceralytics.com/newsletter-sign-up/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Sketchalytics</a></span>: Don’t like reading or watching videos? This newsletter will be right up your street. Every week, you’ll get a mini lesson on marketing in the form of a sketch. It’s a must-have for anyone learning marketing who identifies as a visual learner.</li> \n <li><span style=\"text-decoration: underline;\"><a href=\"https://www.convinceandconvert.com/newsletter/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">Convince &amp; Convert</a></span>: Over 75,000 marketers are subscribed to this newsletter for a reason. It covers everything from content marketing to social media; reading it is a great way to start building your marketing knowledge.</li> \n</ul> \n<div class=\"link-callout\">\n <strong>Recommended Reading:</strong> \n <a href=\"https://coschedule.com/blog/email-marketing-strategy-template/\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener noreferrer\">The Best Way to Organize an Effective Email Marketing Strategy (Template)</a>\n</div> \n<h2>Start Building Your Marketing Knowledge</h2> Ready to start teaching yourself marketing? While this resource guide is a superb starting point, it’s incomplete. There are thousands of resources you can use to build your marketing education. It proves there are countless free and low-cost resources for you to choose from, for any learning style. The internet is your oyster when it comes to learning marketing.
